sourceString: The virus is transmitted through respiratory droplets and through objects.
targetString: Kuli kwasabe dǝ tollo yintǝram ye men-a karaiyya-a men tartǝgǝyin.

sourceString: The coronavirus is a relatively large virus, meaning it is not truly airborne: it will settle down in respiratory droplets.
targetString: Koronabairos dǝ kuli kwasabe dǝwo kura ma, mananzǝ kasam men lejin ba: suro tollo yintǝram ye dǝn nabchin.

sourceString: Staying two metres (six feet) away from other people is usually enough to prevent transmission through this route.
targetString: Mita ndi (gowodǝ arakkǝ) lan katenǝm-a am so-a lan datǝ dǝ ye tartǝgǝ dǝga dabtǝ sǝtǝna layi adǝ men.

sourceString: Transmission from objects can happen, for example, if someone sneezes, touches a doorknob, and then other people touch the doorknob and then touch their faces.
targetString: Tartǝgǝ karaiyya men Muwonjin, misallo, kam la ye watiska sǝkiya, Cinna katǝram lejiya, daji kuru am so ye isa cinna katǝram dǝga leza kuru fuskanza lezayya.

sourceString: The SARS-CoV-2 virus may last on cardboard for up to 24 hours and on plastic for up to 3 days.
targetString: Kuli kwasabe SARS-CoV-2 dǝ raksǝ kela kakkkadi yen awa 24 ro dǝayin, kuru ǝla roba yen kawu 3 nga ro dǝayin.

sourceString: Transmission via the fecal–oral route may also be possible.
targetString: Zawal bǝli-a ciya men tartǝgǝ dǝ shiye Muwonjin.

sourceString: Evidence suggests that COVID-19 is contagious even without symptoms, though to what extent is still being investigated.
targetString: Dalilwa ye fǝlezǝna kǝla COVID-19 dǝ alama kǝndondibe ba yayin tartǝgǝyin ro, amma dǝwo futuwi yeyyi ro dǝ kwamison kǝla kulashi yen kasheru.

sourceString: Common symptoms include a fever, dry cough, and fatigue.
targetString: Alamawa nuwata so dǝ suronzan kange, nzasǝra ngamdu, yinmbaro so mbeji.

sourceString: Other less common symptoms include shortness of breath, a sore throat, headache, muscle pain, or sputum production.
targetString: Alamawa la nguwu ma gǝnyi dǝ sandima yintǝ ganatǝ, daw lilimta, kǝla sǝrǝn, tiyi sǝrǝn, aw kaali tulo so.

sourceString: Some patients have very mild symptoms, similar to a cold.
targetString: Am dondi la so dǝ alamawa gana tantayi ye-a sameǝn ma fǝlejin.

sourceString: Serious complications include pneumonia, acute respiratory distress syndrome, and multi-organ failure leading to disability or death.
targetString: Hal zauro zaudǝn kwasa namusu ye, kwasa yintǝye zauro zaw ma, kuru kǝnduwuwa so Bannatǝ chidaro watǝ so lezǝ nǝm maskin aw kǝrmu ro fǝraksǝyin.

sourceString: About 80% of infections result in mild symptoms, while the remaining may result in hospitalization.
targetString: Kashi 80% suro zamtǝ dǝye dǝ alamawa kambayi fǝlejin, amma gabsǝna dǝ liyitarin buna ro sǝkin.

sourceString: Case fatality rate is estimated at 1-3% of infected individuals, most of whom are elderly with underlying health conditions.
targetString: Tǝadir kǝrmu kwasa dǝ ye dǝ alama 1-3% am zamtǝna dǝ ye yeyi, nguwunza so cariwa dǝwo caman kwasa la gade ye zǝksǝna so.

sourceString: The fatality rate is much higher for those over 70 but significantly lower for those under 40.
targetString: Adadu kǝrmuye dǝ zauro nguwu suro am ngǝlinza 70 yin samin dǝ yen amma zauro gana suro am ngǝlinza 40 yin cidaan dǝ yen.

sourceString: Those most at risk of COVID-19 infection and serious complications are the elderly and those with weakened immune systems or underlying health conditions like cardiovascular disease, diabetes, hypertension, chronic respiratory disease, and cancer.
targetString: Am dǝwo zauro COVID-19 ye zamtǝro tajirwa so dǝ sandima cariwa-a am dǝwo balimi tiyiye kwasa kǝriwtǝye nza duno ba ma so aw kwasa la can zǝkcin so alama kwasa kaltǝgǝye-a kwasa shuwurye-a so, kwasa buye, kwasa yintǝ ye kǝraw ma so, kansa so-a.

sourceString: Not many cases are reported in children and most of these are mild or moderate, though a significant fraction do get pneumonia.
targetString: Kwasa dǝ nguwu duli lan tuwondǝnyi kuru nguwuso kambayi aw dawu dawu, amma adadu gana nguwu kwasa namusu ye mbeji.

sourceString: Occupationally, health care workers have higher risk compared to others with clusters of disease among workers and in health care settings.
targetString: Sanyamen, cidawu nelefa ro cistuwu so dǝ sandima zauro tajirwa wo kǝla cidawu gade katenzan kwasa gana so-a kuru suro naa nǝlefa ro cistuwu ye so dǝn.

sourceString: The time between being exposed to the virus and the emergence of symptoms (incubation period) is typically between 2 and 14 days, though there has been one reported case in China where symptoms appeared 27 days after exposure.
targetString: Loktu dǝwo sa kuli kwasabe dǝ ro letǝgǝ-a alama kǝndondibe dǝ bayantǝnzǝ-a ye de (loktu kaltǝ tambin dǝ) alama kate kate kawu 2 -a 24-a yen, amma dǝwo China lan kam la alama kǝndondibe dǝ sai ngawo kawu 27 yen dǝwo ngawo kuli kwasabe dǝ ro letǝgǝna fǝlewono.

sourceString: As of February 2020, the period of infectiousness is unknown, but is likely most significant when people are symptomatic.
targetString: February 2020 lan, loktu zamtǝye dǝ notǝnyi, amma tǝmata sa am so dǝ alama kǝndondibe fǝlezana lan ro.

sourceString: There is evidence of transmission from people who don't have symptoms, although to what extent is still being investigated.
targetString: Dalilwa Fǝlezǝna kǝla futu kwasa dǝ am so ye tarzayin alama kǝndondibe ba ro ye mbeji, amma jilibi nǝm nguwu nzǝ dǝ kwamison kǝla dǝn kulashi tǝdin.

sourceString: It is unclear whether it is possible to be reinfected with the virus after recovering from it the first time around.
targetString: Asutǝnyi kǝla kamye waltǝ ngawo ngazǝna yen sha sǝtain wa ro.

sourceString: Long-term effects for people who have recovered remain unclear, but there is evidence of reduced lung capacity in some recovered patients.
targetString: Am ngazana ma so dǝye futu sandiya zǝkcin so dǝ kwamison asutǝnyi, amma Dalilwa kela cida fufuye fulutǝnaye mbeji.

sourceString: Testing for the virus usually consists of a swab inserted through the nose or a throat swab which is analysed in a laboratory for the virus.
targetString: Ngalte kuli kwasabe dǝ ye dǝ nguwu so ro kangale kantalla kǝnza men aw dawu men gurustǝgǝ men kuru daji suro jim kulashi ye dǝn kuli kwasabe mbeji la ba ro ngalte turin.

sourceString: The current "gold standard" test involves extracting the genetic material from the sample and analysing it for known genetic markers of the virus.
targetString: Ngaltǝ kǝrmaye shiro "gold standard" gultin ma dǝ awowa alauye dǝ suro bu dǝ yen tutuluwu kuru ngaltǝ alamawa kuli kwasabe dega turin.

sourceString: There is no established test assessing for the virus or antibodies in the blood, although tests are being developed.
targetString: Ngaltǝ la tawatkata kuli kwasabe dǝga suro bu yen aw kulastin so ba, ngalte so dǝ kǝla tandoyen kasheru so yayi.

sourceString: There is no test to establish immunity to the virus.
targetString: Ngaltǝ yi ma kuli kwasabe dǝn faitǝ ye tawatsǝna ma ba.

sourceString: Many governments around the world have advised their citizens not to travel unnecessarily amid the pandemic.
targetString: Lardǝwa kada am nza so wa galazana kǝla wande suro wawa adǝ yen bǝlaro zanyi yen.

sourceString: Lots of airlines and package holidays are making it easy for you by waiving cancellation and change fees.
targetString: Kamfoniwa maraye kada nyiro kǝskezayin kawo dawartǝye-a faltǝye-a watǝgǝ men.

sourceString: Particularly avoid cruise ship travel.
targetString: Musamman maro bǝlaro mara njiye ro katǝne.

sourceString: Older travelers and those with underlying health conditions are most at risk and should avoid travel that puts them at risk, such as long plane flights, visits to crowded places, and especially cruises, even outside of severely affected areas.
targetString: Cariya bǝlaroma so -a am can kwasa laye zǝksǝna so dǝ sandima zauro tajirwa wo kuru bǝlaro dǝwo sandiya tajirwa ro sǝkin so dǝn kata, alama maran bǝlaro kurùwu so, na samno jama nguwuwa ro letǝ so, kuruman musamman ma ro mara njiye so, hatta diya na zauro zamtǝna so ye-a son.

sourceString: In affected areas, most experts recommend a practice known as social distancing.
targetString: Naa dǝwo zamtǝna so dǝn, gonyiwa so ye shawari awo dǝwo sha jama cintutǝ lan notǝna ma dǝye sadin.

sourceString: This means minimising contact with others by keeping a distance of six feet or two meters from them and avoiding gathering together in groups.
targetString: Adǝ mananzǝ dǝ shima am gade so ro fattǝgǝ fulutǝ gowodǝ arakkǝ aw mita ndi kate nyiy-a kam-a ro yo men kuru na falyin sabtǝ ro katǝ men.

sourceString: Some areas permit small groups; others prohibit all group gatherings.
targetString: Na la so dǝ samno am gana ye dǝ amarzayin; na gade so dǝ samno jiliyi yayi dabsayin.

sourceString: Measures you are encouraged to take include working from home whenever possible, avoiding crowds and avoiding leaving your home unless absolutely necessary.
targetString: Katabwa dǝwo nyiya gotǝro galatǝna dǝ sandima faton cidatǝ sayi yayi ro muwonji ma, samno jamayen cintutǝ kuru fannǝmin luwo koltǝ zauro mbu ro gǝnyi walwono wa.

sourceString: If you must go out, try to stay at least 2 meters (6 feet) away from other people.
targetString: Luwumi mbu ro walwono wa, mita ndi (gowodǝ 6) ye kate nyi-a am gade so-a yen.

sourceString: In many places these measures are required.
targetString: Naa kadan katabwa adǝ mǝradǝtǝna.

sourceString: Follow hygiene practices like for flu prevention.
targetString: Nǝm ngǝla jili tantayi ro katǝye dǝ diye.

sourceString: Frequently wash your hands with soap and warm water, and then dry your hands on a clean towel.
targetString: Kǝla kǝlan muskonǝm shawul-a nji zǝmzǝm-a lan tulle, daji muskonǝm dǝga tawul kadawba lan harrǝne.

sourceString: As coronaviruses are enveloped viruses, washing your hands with soap kills the virus by disrupting the mostly fat-based viral envelope.
targetString: coronavirus so dǝ kuli kwasabe dǝwo zakkata dǝga, muskonǝm shawul lan tultǝye sha cejin kayesǝ dǝwo sha zaksǝna ma dǝga kaltǝ men.

sourceString: Effective hand washing requires rubbing your hands for at least 20 seconds.
targetString: Musko tultǝ ngǝlama dǝ sekon 20 ro cintǝ mǝradǝzǝna.

sourceString: Drying your washed hands physically removes some germs from your skin (so don't skip that step, and don't share towels).
targetString: Muskonǝm tullata dǝga hartǝgǝ dǝ zahir ro kuli kwasabe so-a kaziyinǝm lan sutuluyin (adǝ nankadǝro wande adǝ farnǝm konǝmi, kuru wande nyiya kam-a tawul fal faidatǝmi).

sourceString: If soap and water are not available, then use a >60% alcohol-based hand sanitizer.
targetString: Sa shawul-a nji-a ba ro waljiya, daji kǝndǝwu musko tultaye >60% alcohol-based dǝn faidatǝne.

sourceString: Alcohol is a quick germ-killer, but it's not quite instant, so this still requires the same 20 seconds of rubbing your hands together, making sure that every single scrap of skin gets wet, and then you have to wait about another minute, for the alcohol to completely dry.
targetString: Alcohol dǝ nagaduro kuli kwasabe yezoma, amma tinyi ro gǝnyi, adǝ ye sekon 20 ro muskonǝm dǝga cintǝ mǝradǝzǝna, kadiyi dǝ samma lǝksǝna ro tawattǝgǝ, daji kuru man minti fal yeyi ro gǝrenǝm alcohol dǝ cetro harjin.

sourceString: Avoid touching your eyes, nose and mouth with your hands.
targetString: Shimnǝm, kǝnzanǝm, cinǝm-a muskonǝmin letǝro kane.

sourceString: Most people touch their faces every few minutes, all day long.
targetString: Am nguwu so fuskanza minti ganawo son, suoro dubdo ye samman.

sourceString: Try to do this less, and try to wash your hands before touching your face.
targetString: Ngaidǝ gana ro diye, kuru muskonǝm tulle kawu fuskanǝm lenǝmi dǝro.

sourceString: Also, try to avoid touching surfaces you don't have to touch in the first place, at least with your bare hands.
targetString: Kuruman, awowa lenǝmiya mbu gǝnyi so dǝga wande lenǝmi, muskonǝm de lan.

sourceString: Cough and sneeze into your elbow or a tissue, and then immediately throw away the tissue and wash your hands.
targetString: Suro njurominǝm aw tawulye ro nzasǝra-a watiska-a diye, kuru tinyi ro tawul dǝga gǝbne kuru muskonǝm tulle.

sourceString: Don't stand or sit near people who might be sick.
targetString: Wande batku am dondi yen danǝmi aw namnǝmi.

sourceString: Stay at least one meter – and ideally two meters (six feet) – away.
targetString: Gananzǝ mita fal - kuru ngǝlanzǝ dǝ mita ndi (gowodǝ arakkǝ) - lan cintune dane.

sourceString: As a quick way to eyeball this distance, imagine that you and the other person both reached your hands towards each other.
targetString: Futu nagadǝro nǝm cintu dǝga asunǝmin dǝ shima, nyi-a kam gade dǝ-a danuwiyya muskondo hanuwiyya kamando lenuwi ro waljin ro gone.

sourceString: Could you touch the other person's hand without taking a step towards that person?
targetString: Rangnǝm musko kam gadeye dǝga lenǝmin wa gǝrtǝmba ro?

sourceString: If the answer is yes, then you're too close.
targetString: Jawawunǝm dǝ aa ma, daji nyi dǝ zauro karǝngǝ.

sourceString: Clean objects and surfaces that a lot of people touch, such as doorknobs, phones, and television remotes with regular household cleaner.
targetString: Awowa-a na-a am so ye nguwu ro lezain dǝga fǝrane, alama cinna katǝram yeyi, talfon, rimot tibi ye so dǝ awo karaiy tultǝye fatoye nowata ma dǝ lan tulle.

sourceString: Disinfect the surfaces with a suitable disinfectant, such as diluted household bleach.
targetString: Kurun kuli yezoye fǝtkǝgǝne kurun kuli yezoye sandǝna lan, alama shawul njiya kǝllatǝ ma faton faidtǝye ma dǝ so.

sourceString: Stay home when you are sick, and avoid contact with other people until your symptoms are gone.
targetString: Sa nyi dondi ma faton namne, kuru gade so ro fattǝgǝ ro katǝne hatta nganǝmiya dǝwo.

sourceString: Do not share personal items that come into contact with saliva, such as toothbrushes, eating utensils, drinks, water bottles, and towels.
targetString: Wande awowa kǝlamra ro faidatǝye dǝwo njululu wa lejin so dǝ am gade wa fatǝmi, alama ciwu sheli cintǝye, awowa kǝmbu boye, awo kǝnzaye, jiwi nji kǝnzaye, tawul so-a.

sourceString: The practice of serving yourself from a common plate with your own chopsticks, common in China, should be avoided.
targetString: Futu kǝlanǝm ro kǝmbu tasa ndusoye faidatin ro fiyim kangale nǝm kǝmbu boye lan, China ndusoye sǝdin dǝ, watǝ koltǝ.

sourceString: Greet people without touching them.
targetString: Am so wa liwane sandiya lenǝmba ro.

sourceString: Avoid hugs, kisses, handshakes, fist bumps, and any other contact.
targetString: Ganji kǝltǝ so, nzǝwoktǝ so, ngǝluwu yalta so-a letǝgǝ jiliyi yayi ro katǝne.

sourceString: If it's impossible to avoid contact, then wash your hands both before and after.
targetString: Rangnǝm letǝgǝ dǝro katǝmba ma, daji muskonǝm kawu dǝro-a ngawo dǝn-a so tulle.

sourceString: It won't protect you from the coronavirus, but it will partially protect you from the flu, which remains a greater risk than COVID-19 in many areas.
targetString: Nyiya koronabairos dǝ ro kaziyinmba wo, amma niya tantayi dǝro sakǝyin, shi dǝwo ne COVID-19 dǝma wa tajirwan kozuna de.

sourceString: This also saves you from unnecessary worry if you get the flu and think it might be the coronavirus.
targetString: Adǝye nyiya hangalza faida ba ro sǝkayin sa tantayi ye nyiya sǝtaiyya kuru koronabairos nǝm karam ma.

sourceString: If you are elderly or otherwise in a high-risk group and can be vaccinated for pneumonia, get that vaccination.
targetString: Nyi cari ro wallam wa aw suro am zauro tajirwa ye dǝn ro wallam wa kuru rangnǝm kalimi kwasa namusu ye dǝ gonǝmin ma, kalimi adǝga gone.

sourceString: It won't protect you from viral pneumonia from COVID-19, but some COVID-19 patients have died of bacterial pneumonia that attacked their weakened lungs, so a pneumonia vaccination could save your life.
targetString: Nyiya kuli kwasa namusu ye COVID-19 ye dǝro sǝkayin ba wo, amma am COVID-19 ye sǝtana la so bazana sawo kuli kwasa namusu ye fufunza lawro walzǝna dǝga sǝtana ro, adǝ nankadǝro kalimi kwasa namusu ye dǝ ronǝm wa sǝkayin.

sourceString: Wearing masks is recommended for those who are suspected of carrying of disease and those who are in close contact with those infected.
targetString: Am tiyin kwasa wa ro tǝmata so-a am am zamtǝna ro letana so-a dǝro shawari zambu fǝskaye dǝ yiko tina,

sourceString: For those who are asymptomatic, the WHO does not recommend masks, though some national governments do.
targetString: Am dǝwo alamawa kǝndondibe fǝlezanyi so dǝ, WHO ye zambu yiko ro shawari cinyi, son yayi gomnatiwa la so dǝ sadin

sourceString: Wearing a mask of some kind is required in some countries and cities in an effort to reduce community transmission.
targetString: Zambu yiko lardǝwa la-a bǝrniwa la lan mǝradǝtǝna kasadǝnza dawu jamayen tartǝgǝ dǝ fulutǝ yen.

sourceString: There are worldwide shortages of surgical masks.
targetString: Dina samman zambu fǝskaye dǝ ganazǝna.

sourceString: If you do wear a mask, make sure to use it correctly.
targetString: Zambu dǝ yikǝmin ma ngǝlaro yikǝma ro tawatkǝne.

sourceString: The mask should cover your nose and mouth and fit without gaps.
targetString: Zambu dǝye kǝnzamen-a cinǝm-a zaksǝ kalkal ro ba gana ma kolzǝnyi ro.

sourceString: Wash your hands before putting on the mask and avoid touching the mask while wearing it.
targetString: Muskonǝm tulle kawu zambu dǝ yikǝmin ro kuru wande zambu dǝga lenǝmi sa yikǝmin dǝn.

sourceString: If you do touch it, wash your hands immediately afterwards.
targetString: Leyen ro walwono wa, tinyi ro muskonǝm tulle.

sourceString: When the mask becomes damp, discard and replace it.
targetString: Sa zambu dǝ lǝkciya, gǝbne gaden falne.

sourceString: Remove it from the back, throw it away, and then wash your hands.
targetString: Ngawo men tule, gǝbne, daji muskonǝm tulle.

sourceString: Remember that masks are not a substitute for good hygiene: continue to wash your hands frequently.
targetString: Tangne diya zambu dǝ nǝm ngǝlan faltinmba diya: muskonǝm kǝla kǝlan tultǝ dǝ gowone kone.

sourceString: Don't stock up on masks if you don't need them.
targetString: Wande zambu dǝ yiwum samnǝmi mǝradǝnm ba ma.

sourceString: Mask shortages mean that healthcare workers are having trouble getting a hold of masks, which puts everyone at risk.
targetString: Zambu ye ganatǝ dǝ mananzǝ cidawu nǝlefabe so dǝ zambu fando ro terin, adǝ ye nduso wa tajirwa ro sǝkin.

sourceString: That includes N95 respirators, which are not recommended for the general public – these are specialist equipment which must be fitted to be optimally effective.
targetString: Adǝye surodǝn N95 respirators so ye mbeji, shi dǝwo ne jama meuye faidatǝro sandǝnyi ma dǝ - sandi adǝ karaiyya cidaye musamman ye dǝwo sai ngalte kalkaljiya dǝwo ngǝla ro cidajin.

sourceString: Leave them for healthcare workers.
targetString: Cidawu nǝlefabe ro kollune.

sourceString: Avoid crowded areas, especially enclosed areas without much air circulation, such as conferences, performances, shopping malls, public transportation, and religious services.
targetString: Naa samno jamayen cintune, musamman ma ro naa dǝwo zakkata so ngǝlaro kasam gaa suluyin ba so dǝ, alama njim samnoye, njim biskeye, kanti lǝwayeye, awo kǝmbaye jama meumi ye so-a na adinye so-a.

sourceString: Events which involve a large scale gathering of people, from religious pilgrimages to music concerts, are being canceled worldwide, in an effort to contain the spread of the virus.
targetString: Wudǝrwa zauro jama nguwu sabtin so, jitǝ adinye son tai samno kaiyya yetǝ ye ro kode dina samman sabtǝna, suro Kasadǝ kuli kwasabe dǝ tartǝgǝ dǝga kǝriwtǝyen.

sourceString: Tourist attractions, businesses, and transportation may be closed, especially in affected countries.
targetString: Naa hawar kuruye so, kasuwuwa, awowa kǝmbaye-a samma waneye zaktin, musamman ma ro lardǝwa zamtǝna so dǝn.

sourceString: Some canceled events, especially performances, sporting events, and classes, are being moved online, which means you can experience them without traveling.
targetString: La so dǝ wudǝrra dabsa, musamman ma ro biske so, biskewa tiyi mazatǝye so, darasǝ gotǝ so-a, sandiya onlayin ro kalak iya, mananzǝ rangnǝm sandiya dimin bǝlaronǝmi yayi.

sourceString: At petrol/gas stations, use gloves or wipe down the handle with a disinfectant wipe if you can.
targetString: Naa fetǝr/gas-a lodoyen, zambu muskoyen aw tarana dǝga cinne dina cintǝye kurun kuli yezoyeya lan rangnǝmin ma.

sourceString: After filling up, clean your hands with hand sanitizer.
targetString: Ngawo mbulimayen, muskonǝm kandawu musko tultaye dǝn tulle.

sourceString: The U.S. and Canadian governments recommend avoiding travel by cruise ship.
targetString: Gomnati U.S ye-a Canada ye-a dǝ ye shawari wande mara njiye lan bǝlarotǝnyi ye sadǝ.

sourceString: Infections spread easily on board, and medical care is limited.
targetString: Kwasa so dǝ nagadǝro tartǝgǝyin kǝla awo kǝmbayen, kuru nǝlefa cistuwu y mawwata.

sourceString: Amid a cruise ship outbreak, quarantines and docking are challenging partly due to the large number of people aboard.
targetString: Dawu Suro mara njiyen tartǝgǝ yen, kortǝ-a lǝbtǝ-a dǝ zauro kaziyiyya sawo jama nguwu kǝla awo kǝmbaye dǝyen

sourceString: Even cruise ships without confirmed cases have been denied permission to dock due to virus fears, and in the high-profile case of the Diamond Princess in Japan, hundreds of people were infected on the ship.
targetString: Hatta mara njiye dǝwo zamtǝnyi so ma datǝ ro sabtǝna kuli kwasabe dǝro ritǝro, kuru kwasa dǝye kura ma Diamond Princess ye suro Japan ye dǝn, am yar kada zamtǝna suro mara njiye dǝyen.

sourceString: If you believe you may be infected, call a hospital or local emergency medical services instead of going in person to avoid infecting others.
targetString: Nyiya zamzǝna ro fanǝmiya, liyitari bowone aw cidaram nǝlefaye nyin karǝngǝn ma sudu nyi kǝlanǝm lan letǝ dǝro wande am gade do ro tarrǝgǝmi ro.

sourceString: Mention your symptoms and travel history.
targetString: Alamawa nǝm kǝndondibe-a hawar bǝlaronǝm ye-a dǝ gulle.

sourceString: Wear a medical mask and follow the instructions of authorities and doctors.
targetString: Zambu fuskaye liyitariye ma dǝ yike kuru kashimowa huwuma-a liyitawa ye-a do dǝ gayi.

sourceString: See also: Flight and health
targetString: Adǝyeyi ma kuru ruyi: Citǝ maraye-a nǝlefa-a

sourceString: On a plane, follow the same hygiene practices as anywhere else: wash hands frequently, or use alcohol-based hand sanitizer if it's not convenient to leave your seat, and avoid touching your face.
targetString: Suro maraye dǝn, futu hal nǝm ngǝlaye naa gadeye so dǝ ma gayi: muskonǝm kǝla kǝlan tulle, aw kǝndǝwu musko tultaye "alcohol-based" ma dǝn faidatǝne sa kurisnǝm dǝ kolnǝm citǝ dǝ kaziyiyya ma, fuskanǝm letǝro katǝne.

sourceString: Researchers have found that passengers in window seats have less risk of contact with sick people.
targetString: Kulashiwu so ye asuzana kǝla kǝmbawu dǝwo kurisnza ma tagaye dǝ sandima am dondi ro letǝgǝna gana wo ro.

sourceString: Try to book a window seat, and avoid moving around the cabin during the flight.
targetString: Ngǝnǝbtǝne kuris na tagaye ya ro, kuru suro maraye dǝn fomtǝro katǝne sa mara dǝ lejin lan.

sourceString: After washing your hands and before sitting down, use disinfectant wipes to wipe down the area around your seat.
targetString: Ngawo muskonǝm gulluma yen kuru kaw namnǝmin ro, dina cintǝram Kurunna ma dǝn faidatǝne shiti shiti kurisnǝm ye so dǝ cinne.

sourceString: Wipe hard surfaces, and if your seat is leather you can wipe that too.
targetString: Naa cîbbu so dǝga cinne, kuru kurisnǝm dǝ karadiye ma shiye rangnǝm cinnǝmin.

sourceString: Don't wipe a cloth seat, as the moisture can make transmission easier.
targetString: Wande kuris dinaye dǝ cinnǝmin, dalilnzǝ dǝ nji dǝ tartǝgǝ butuwa ro sǝdin dǝ ro.

sourceString: When using disinfectant wipes, follow the instructions on the packaging.
targetString: Sa dina cintǝram Kurunna ma dǝn faidatǝmin ma, kashimowa tiyi dǝ ye dǝ gayi faidatǝne.

sourceString: And remember, viruses enter through your mouth, nose, and eyes – wiping down the area doesn't hurt, but it's not a substitute for proper hygiene.
targetString: Kuru tangne diya, kuli kwasabe so dǝ cinǝm men, kǝnzanǝm men, kuru shimnǝm men son gayin - naa cintǝ so aziyanjin ba, amma shi dǝ nǝm ngǝla ngǝla man fǝltinmba diya.

sourceString: Wash your hands and avoid touching your face.
targetString: Muskonǝm tulle kuru fuskanǝm letǝro katǝne.

sourceString: And use a tissue to touch the touch screen or other controls.
targetString: Kuru tawul yin faidatǝne touch screen so aw awowa gade so lenǝmin ma.

sourceString: When using the lavatory, use paper towels to turn off the faucet and open the door, then throw them away.
targetString: Sa aw sami ro kǝmbaye dǝwo shiro "lavatory" sayin dǝn faidatǝmin ma, tawul kakkadi yen faidatǝne yeje kuru cinna dǝga kane, daji gǝbne.

sourceString: Airlines in affected areas are taking steps to reduce transmission and keep passengers safe.
targetString: Kamfoniwa maraye so dǝ naa zamtǝna so dǝ lan katabwa gozana kǝla tartǝgǝ dǝga fulutǝro kuru nǝlefa kǝmbawu ye tawattǝ ro.

sourceString: For instance, these may include cleaning facilities more frequently, allowing flight attendants to wear masks, and serving prepackaged instead of freshly heated meals.
targetString: Misallo, suro dǝn naa cidaye dǝ so kǝla kǝlan fǝratǝ so, cidawu maraye so dǝga kollǝm zambu fǝskaye yiko so, kuru kǝmbu caman dawarrata kǝnjo so sudu kǝmbu bǝlin ro gǝttǝna ye ro.

sourceString: If a group of passengers is connecting from an area with a severe outbreak, the flight attendants may be able to seat them away from the rest of the passengers (and if you were recently in a high-risk area, consider telling the flight attendants for this reason).
targetString: Kǝmbawu la so dǝ bǝla zauro zamtǝna lan isayin ma, cidama maraye dǝ ye raksǝ sandiya sǝri lan gǝnajin kǝmbu gabsǝna dǝro kǝltayin ba ro (kuru nyi dǝ karǝngǝn ma zauro zamtǝna ro lenǝma ma, cidama maraye dǝ ro gulle dalil adǝ nankaro).

sourceString: You may be prohibited from changing seats on the flight.
targetString: Nyiya kuris faltǝro dabtin suro mara dǝ yen.

sourceString: This is so that, if someone on the flight turns out to be infected, the authorities can track down the people who were sitting near them for testing or quarantine.
targetString: Ade dalil dǝ shima, sa kam la suro mara ye dǝn zamtǝna ro waljiya, huwuma so ye kǝla kambayiyan am badkunzǝn nabsana so dǝga mazǝ gojin sandiya ngaltǝ-a kortǝ-a ro.

sourceString: COVID-19 is treated by relieving symptoms and preventing complications.
targetString: COVID-19 dǝ sha ngatǝyin alama dǝ fulutǝ-a zawtǝro fatǝ-a men.

sourceString: There is no vaccine or specific treatment for the novel coronavirus.
targetString: Kalimi aw kurun la musamman ye koronabairos bǝlin adǝye ba.

sourceString: Research into a vaccine or specific antiviral drug is underway.
targetString: Kulashi kǝla kalimi aw kurun kuli kwasabe musamman ye tǝdinna kara.

sourceString: There are a variety of trials using HIV medications and other novel antiviral medications for treatment of COVID-19.
targetString: Kasadǝ kada tǝdǝna kǝla kurun HIV yen kuru Kurunwa gade kuli kwasabe bǝlin so ye-a lan kǝla COVID-19 kurun tǝ yen.

sourceString: Mild symptoms may be relieved by taking paracetamol (acetaminophen).
targetString: Alamawa kambayi so dǝ paracetamol ya men ngajin (acetaminophen).

sourceString: If you are infected with COVID-19, countries will isolate you until several consecutive tests for COVID-19 are negative.
targetString: Nyiya COVID-19 sǝtaiyya, lardǝwa so ye nyiya korzayin sai ngal kada kǝla COVID-19 tǝdǝ ba ro tawatsayiyya dǝwo.

sourceString: If you have been in close contact with someone infected with COVID-19, many countries will quarantine you for 14 days since the last exposure and monitor you for signs and symptoms.
targetString: Kam la COVID-19 ye sǝtana ro lerǝgǝmiya, lardǝwa kada nyiya korza gǝnazayin kawu 14 ro tǝn sa dareye letǝgǝ ma yen kuru nyiro hangal kǝnazayin alama la bayantǝ ro.

sourceString: Some countries will also test you even if you don't have symptoms.
targetString: Lardǝwa la so dǝye nyiya ngalzayin alamawa nyi lan ba yayi.

sourceString: In many countries, the healthcare system has been stretched to the point of not being able to handle the sheer number of patients, and there is a chance you may be refused treatment due to the lack of available medical staff, supplies or equipment.
targetString: Lardǝwa kadan, fasalla nǝlefa ye so dǝga tǝmbǝluwuna hatta raksa kam dondi falma samoyin ba ro, kuru alama nyiya muwoba ye mbeji sawo liyita ba, Kurunna ba aw karaiyya cidaye ba ro.

sourceString: Many countries have shut down or severely limited flights, ships, and border crossings, especially to and from affected areas.
targetString: Lardǝwa kada mara samiye citǝ, mara njiye-a kalangay fartǝ-a dabsana aw zauro fuluzana, musamman ma ro naa zamtǝna ro letǝ-a kǝnshe-a so dǝga.

sourceString: Even more countries have imposed restrictions on arriving travelers, either barring entry (maybe with an exception for local citizens and permanent residents) or requiring you to be quarantined, typically for 14 days.
targetString: Kwa yayi lardǝwa kada bǝlaron kǝnshewu so ro kal sakǝna, imma cetro ga ro sabtǝna (waneye am lardǝye so-a am amari jiddum ro nabtǝye-a so dǝ dawunmba) aw nyiya kortǝ mǝradǝzain kawu 14 ro.

sourceString: Even if a mandatory quarantine is not imposed, you may be asked to "self-quarantine" by staying at home and not interacting with other people.
targetString: Nyiya mbu ro sakǝ korzanyi yayi, nyiya sakǝ "kǝlanǝmla men kǝlanǝm kornǝmin" faton nabtǝ am gade so ro fattǝgǝ ba men.

sourceString: The most severe restrictions are on travellers who have recently been to affected areas, but increasingly many countries are applying them to incoming travellers overall.
targetString: Kal dǝwo zaw ma so dǝ kǝla am dǝwo karǝngǝn bǝlawa zamtǝna so ro lezana yen, amma kǝrma dǝ lardǝwa kada kǝla am bǝlaron kǝnshewu so samma son sadin.

sourceString: Some countries have even prohibited all or almost all foreigners from entry or limited the ability of local citizens and residents to leave.
targetString: Lardǝwa la so dǝ ye am lardǝ diya samma aw samma karǝngeya ga ro dabsana aw am bǝlaye ye luwon za fuluzana.

sourceString: What are the affected areas?
targetString: Nda so naa zamtǝna so dǝ?

sourceString: Well, this is a fast-changing situation, and each country/region/organization has its own list of what areas are subject to restrictions.
targetString: Adǝ ma dǝ hal dǝwo nagaduro faltin ma, kuru lardǝwi yo so/nasha bi yo so/ kara kawu yo so suwanzǝ naa kal tikin ye mbeji.

sourceString: The city of Wuhan is on every list and the rest of mainland China is on most.
targetString: Bǝrni Wuhan ye dǝ ndarason mbeji kuru bǝla gade China ye so dǝ naa nguwu son mbeji.

sourceString: Other areas that are often included: France, Germany, Hong Kong, Iran, Italy, Japan, Macau, Singapore, South Korea, Spain, Taiwan, the United Kingdom, the United States, the Schengen Area as a whole, and sometimes various others.
targetString: Naa gade dǝwo nguwu so ro kǝltǝyin dǝ: France, Germany, Hong Kong, Iran, Italy, Japan, Macau, Singapore, South Korea, Spain, Taiwan, the United Kingdom, the United States, nasha Schengen ye samma, kuru saku lan gade kada.

sourceString: Some countries have imposed restrictions based on citizenship or residency from severely affected areas.
targetString: Lardǝwa la so dǝ ye kal dǝ lǝatar lardǝ kam ye ro aw nabtǝ baa zauro zamtǝna yen ro kuru ceko.

sourceString: A detailed list of entry restrictions is maintained by the IATA.
targetString: Suwa dǝwo ga ro sabtǝna kamil ro na IATA yen mbeji.

sourceString: It doesn't cover all the restrictions, but it's still useful.
targetString: Dabtǝ dǝ samma kǝreznyi, amma kwayaye faida.

sourceString: Keep up to date—the outbreak and the travel restrictions are changing rapidly.
targetString: Sayi so ro bǝlingǝwune - falangtǝ dǝ-a kal bǝlaro ye de-a nagadǝro faltin.

sourceString: For travel in the near future, consider making refundable reservations in case the changing situation forces you to change your plans.
targetString: Na adǝ fuwun bǝlaronǝmin ma, fasal bǝlaro ye muwonzǝnyi ma kawonǝm kalaktǝyin ma dǝ karne hal la sǝkǝ bǝlaro nǝm dǝ dawarram ma.

sourceString: Avoid buying tickets with a connection in an affected area – even changing planes can make you subject to restrictions.
targetString: Tiket ba zamtǝna leyata so ro yiwon katǝne - mara faltǝ bas ma ye cin ro kal suwudin.

sourceString: Flights may get canceled with little notice, either due to the disease's spread and ever-changing entry restrictions, or simply because fewer people are flying and airlines are having trouble filling seats.
targetString: Citǝ maraye so dǝ tadǝban tǝrayin, walaw kwasa dǝ nankaro kuru kal gaye dǝwo fafaltin ma dero, aw biya am mara ro kǝmba ma so dǝ gana nankaro kamfoniwa maraye dǝ kaziyi kuris mbuleoye gǝrezǝna ro

sourceString: You might also be delayed for hours upon arrival waiting for temperature checks and related procedures and paperwork, or even get quarantined for two weeks.
targetString: Waneye nyiya awa kada ro wahartǝyin loktu isǝma dǝn kawdo tiyiye ngaltǝro kuru katabwa anyi so wa wuzǝna so-a kakkadi mbulo so-a nankaro, aw nyiya mawu ndi yayi ro kortin.

sourceString: Be prepared for the possibility of disruption to your travel plans, especially if traveling internationally.
targetString: Bǝlaronǝm dǝ muwonzǝ wurtine ro dawartǝna musamman ma ro lardǝ diya ye ro bǝlaronǝmin ma.

sourceString: Even if you're nowhere near affected areas there's a risk that you'll have to stay at the destination longer than planned if you've shared a building or vessel with an infected person.
targetString: Nyi dǝ na zamtǝna dǝn cintun yayi na dǝama dǝn loktu kuruwu futu nyanǝma dǝga kozǝna ro dǝamin nyiya kam zamtǝna kor falyin namnǝma ma.

sourceString: For example, in late February an Italian doctor on vacation in Costa Adeje (Canary Islands) was diagnosed with COVID-19, and as a result all the guests in the hotel he stayed at were quarantined.
targetString: Misallo, dareye february yen liyita la Italy ye batalla lan Costa Adeje (Canary Islands) sha ngaltǝ tiyinzǝn COVID-19 tuwondǝna, adǝ ye sǝkǝ am dǝwo suro hotel dǝ ye dǝ samma so kortǝ gǝnatǝ.

sourceString: Lockdowns and other internal restrictions
targetString: Layi zaktǝ so kal yiko la gade so

sourceString: Some countries and regions, especially severely affected ones, are implementing emergency lockdowns and restrictions on people's movements and activities, even for those who haven't recently been abroad.
targetString: Lardǝwa la-a nasha la -a so dǝ, musamman ma ro naa dǝwo zauro zamtǝna so dǝ, jama so ro kal duwasashi ye-a layi zaktǝ so-a sakin cidawa gambo am so ye ro kam ngaltema lardǝ diya ye ro sulunyi yayi.

sourceString: These include the temporary reintroduction of some border controls, restrictions on travel within the country, closing or limiting service at restaurants and other establishments, banning large public events, and in the most severe cases prohibiting people from leaving the house except for essential reasons.
targetString: Adǝ suro dǝn kalangaiyya kawudǝyero zaktǝ so, suro lardǝ yen bǝlaro so ro kal yiko so, naa kǝmbu ladoye-a naa gade so zaktǝ aw fulutǝ so, wudǝrra jama meu sabtayin so dabtǝ so, naa zauro zaw so dǝn am so wa faton luwo ro dabtǝ illa mbu ro gǝnyi walwono wa.

sourceString: Beyond government restrictions, individual establishments are shutting their doors and cancelling events to try to reduce the spread of the virus.
targetString: Kal yiko gomnati ye dǝ ma dawunmba ro, cidaram so runza ro cinnanza so zaksai wudǝrra so dawarzana kasadǝnza kuli kwasabe dǝ tartǝgǝ dabtǝ fulutǝ ro.

sourceString: In China, there are extensive restrictions on transportation and activity, which vary widely by province, city, and even by district or village.
targetString: China lan kal dunuwa tǝkǝna kǝla awowa kǝmbaye-a cidawa so yen, shi dǝwo ne gadejin lǝatar bǝla, bǝrni, hatta lǝatar bǝladiya ye ro.

sourceString: Many governments recommend against traveling to China at this time.
targetString: Gomnatiwa kada kǝla wande China ro bǝlaro tǝnyi yen shawari sadǝna loktu adǝ lan.

sourceString: If you have no choice, do your research and get up-to-date information about the local situation wherever you are going.
targetString: Awo rangnǝma ba ma, kulashinǝm de kuru hawar bǝlin mane fande kǝla hawar na lenǝmin dǝyen.

sourceString: People who have traveled to Hubei face particularly severe restrictions.
targetString: Am dǝwo Hubei ro bǝlaro zana so dǝ kal zaw ma sandiro tǝdin.

sourceString: Examples of restrictions that you may encounter in some parts of China (this is not an exhaustive list):
targetString: Misalla kal dǝwo China lan fandimin so dǝ (adǝ samma so gǝnyi isabtǝ):

sourceString: 14-day quarantine, self-quarantine, or COVID-19 test upon arrival from other parts of China or from other countries, at your expense
targetString: Kortǝ kawu 14 ye, kǝlanǝmlaro kǝlanǝm kortǝ, aw ngalte COVID-19 ye sa isǝm bǝlawa gade China yen aw lardǝ gaden zǝmnǝma kalyin, liwnǝmin.

sourceString: questions about your travel and medical history (lying can get you years in prison)
targetString: Koro kǝla bǝlaro nǝmye-a hawar nǝlefanǝm ye-a (kattuwu kamtǝ nyiya saa kadaro fǝrzǝnari ro sǝkin)

sourceString: mandatory registration using an online or paper form
targetString: Su babro yiko mbu ye onlayin lan aw fom kakkadi ye men

sourceString: requirement to wear a face mask in public
targetString: Mǝradǝ zambu fǝskaye daw jamayen yiko ye

sourceString: people who have been outside of China within 14 days not allowed into public places like malls
targetString: Am dewo China diyan ro bǝlaro zana suro kawu 14 yen so dǝ sandiya dawu jamaye ro ga sabtǝna alama kasuwu so yeyi

sourceString: shops only accept mobile payments, not cash
targetString: Kantiwa so dǝ kawo adutǝ mobile ye samoyin, kawo bǝl gǝnyi

sourceString: restaurants, transportation and other establishments refusing service to non-Chinese citizens
targetString: Naa kǝmbu ladoye so, awowa kǝmbaye so, cidaramwa gade so-a dǝ am lardǝ China gǝnyi ma so dero sakolodǝyinmba

sourceString: many forms of transportation reduced or shut down
targetString: Awowa kǝmbaye jili kada fulutǝna aw zaktǝna

sourceString: mandatory real-name registration for public transit cards
targetString: Su hayyaye babro mbu ro yiko kati awowa kǝmbaye jama meumi ye ro

sourceString: access in and out of a town, village, or city completely blocked
targetString: Zawal gaw-a luwo-a bǝlaye, bǝladiya ye, aw bǝrni ye so dǝ cetro zakkata

sourceString: non-resident visitors prohibited from entering apartment complexes
targetString: Am lardǝye gǝnyi so dǝga fatowa ro ga dabtǝna

sourceString: only allowed to go outside once every two days to get supplies
targetString: Kawu ndi lan fal ro bas sandiya koltǝ saluwu awowo mǝradǝzana so suwondayin

sourceString: businesses, activities, and attractions closed
targetString: Kasuwu so, cida so, naa hawar kuruye so zaktǝna

sourceString: businesses need local government permission to re-open
targetString: Kasuwuwa so amari huwuma gana ye mǝradǝzana Waltǝm fǝrǝmtǝ ro

sourceString: restaurants (if they are even open) require a minimum distance between customers
targetString: Na kǝmbu ladoye so (katǝna man) kate kate liwayawu dǝ cintutǝ mǝradǝzǝna

sourceString: selling substandard face masks has a maximum sentence of life imprisonment
targetString: Zambu fuskaye ngalawu gǝnyi ma lodo dǝ hanzǝ kǝnǝnganǝm ro joro

sourceString: As of mid-March 2020, Europe is the epicenter of the epidemic, and many European countries have closed their borders to international travel - only border commuters and freight are allowed to cross.
targetString: Dawu March 2020 ye dǝn, Europe dǝ shima dawdi wawa dǝye wo kuru lardǝwa Europe ye kada kalangay nza zaksana lardǝ diya yero bǝlaro ro - bǝlaroma cidaye-a karaiyya-a bas kotǝ amartǝ.

sourceString: Also businesses other than food stores and pharmacies are closed, and public transport has been reduced or stopped.
targetString: Kuruman kasuwuwa kǝmbu-a kurunye-a kojiya samma fuluwata aw zakkata.

sourceString: In the worst affected countries including Italy, Spain and France, lockdowns like in China in January, have been implemented.
targetString: Lardǝwa zauro lezǝna so dǝ suro dǝn Iǝn Italy, Spain France -a, zawal zaktǝ so jili China lan suro January ye dǝyeyi, tǝdǝna.

sourceString: As well the EU has closed its outer borders.
targetString: Adǝyeyi ma EU ye kalangaiyya nzǝ zaksǝna.

sourceString: COVID-19 is prevalent also in North America.
targetString: COVID-19 dǝ nguwuzǝna North America lan.

sourceString: The borders between Canada, the U.S., and Mexico are closed to non-essential travel, and in many areas bans on big gatherings are in effect (this means places like restaurants are closed, and events are canceled).
targetString: Kalangaiyya Kate kate Canada, the U.S., Mexico -a ye bǝlaro mbu gǝnyi so ro zaktǝna, kuru naa kadan zamno jama nguwu ye dabtǝna (adǝ mananzǝ shima naa alama ba kǝmbu ladoye so yeyi zaktǝna, wudǝrra so ye dawartǝna).

sourceString: Numerous state, county, and municipal jurisdictions have issued stay-at-home orders that require all nonessential businesses to close.
targetString: Kǝrwewa, lardǝwa, bǝlawa kada huwom faton-nabtǝ ye kamzana shi dǝwo ne kasuwuwa mbu gǝnyi so samma zaktǝ mǝradǝzǝna ma.

sourceString: With lots of flights canceled, warnings issued, and restrictions imposed, flying in the time of coronavirus can be a challenge.
targetString: Suro citǝ mara ye kada dawartǝna, sumo gǝrtǝna, kal tǝkǝna yen, maran bǝlaro suro loktu koronabairos ye dǝn zauro kaziyiyya.

sourceString: Some routes are not possible.
targetString: Zawalwa la ga ro muwonjinmba.

sourceString: Others will require more inconvenient connections than usual—multiple stops and long waits between flights.
targetString: La dǝ ye kǝltǝ kuttu so mǝradǝzǝna buro wa kozǝna ro - datǝ nguwu so-a gǝretǝ kuruwu-a kate kate mara fartǝ yen.

sourceString: In some cases that means more expensive tickets.
targetString: Hal la so dǝn Adǝ mananzǝ tiket taman zauwwa nguwu.

sourceString: On the other hand, the good news is that many flights are cheaper than usual due to decreased demand, and there's a decent chance you'll get an empty seat next to you.
targetString: Hal la dǝ yen, hawar kǝji dǝ shima mara kada taman nza ca ro butu wo sawo mǝradǝ fulutǝna ye ro, sa kuris de batkunǝmin fandoye mbeji.

sourceString: Build in extra time for your connections, especially if transferring from an international flight to a domestic flight and especially if your itinerary involves a country that's seriously affected.
targetString: Loktu nguwu gone kǝltǝnǝm dǝro, musamman ma ro sa mara lardǝ diya yen cinǝm mara suro lardǝ ye ro faltǝgǝmin ma kuru musamman ma ro sa zawalwa nǝm bǝlaro ye so dǝn lardǝwa zauro zamtǝna so mbeji ma.

sourceString: Screenings, temperature checks, extra paperwork, and the associated waiting around can add minutes or hours before you're allowed to continue on your journey.
targetString: Sasǝrtǝ, kawdo tiyiye ngalte, kakkadi mbulio nguwu, kuru gǝretǝ nguwu so dǝ raksǝ mintiwa aw awaa kada sǝrayin kawu nyiya koltǝ bǝlaro nǝm gowom kornǝmin dǝ.

sourceString: You may find it harder than usual to buy a ticket to or from a destination subject to warnings and restrictions.
targetString: Tiket ba ro letǝ-a kǝnshe-a ye yiwo dǝ zaw ro waljin sumo gǝrtǝ-a kal so wa lan dǝwo.

sourceString: This is a real concern if you're trying to get out of an affected area.
targetString: Adǝ kaziyi kura sa ma zamtǝna lan luwumin ma.

sourceString: For instance, most aggregators are not selling tickets from China to the United States (presumably to avoid falling afoul of restrictions and being on the hook for a passenger's flight out).
targetString: Misallo, tiket lodoma so dǝ tiket China lan cinǝm United States ro letǝ ye solodin ba (tǝmatǝna wande kal la ro sakorunyi ro kuru wande mara citǝ kǝmbawu ye kǝbtǝnyi ro).

sourceString: To buy a ticket for an itinerary like this, you may have to contact the airline or use a lesser-known aggregator.
targetString: Tiket jili zawal adǝye yiwumin ma, sai kamfoni mara ye dǝga nandiya aw kam tiket lodoma la notǝnyi lan faidatǝmiya.

sourceString: Another possibility is to buy two separate tickets (for instance, a ticket from China to Cambodia and a second ticket from Cambodia to the U.S.), but be careful you won't get quarantined or lose your luggage in between.
targetString: Zawal la gade dǝ shima tiket gade gade indi yiwumin (misallo, tiket China lan Cambodia ro letǝye kuru tiket kǝn ndimi ye dǝ Cambodia lan cinǝm U.S. ro letǝye), amma hangal genane nuyya kortǝ gǝnatinmba kuru karaiyyanǝm ye kate kate dǝn fassǝyinmba.

sourceString: Connecting flights can be a problem.
targetString: Mara falyin cinǝm gade ro kotǝ dǝ kaziyiyya ro waljin.

sourceString: The risk of getting stuck in the connection city is higher than usual right now, due to delays for screening and testing as well as extensive cancellations.
targetString: Tajirwa bǝla mara gade ro faltǝye dǝn kǝbtǝye dǝ zauro nguwu ma nowata dǝro wumgǝmiya, sawo wahartǝ ma sasǝrtǝyen-a ngaltǝ-a dawarta nguwu-a yen.

sourceString: Connecting in an affected area may lead to entry restrictions later on, and if you've been in an affected area recently some countries won't even let you change planes.
targetString: Bǝla zamtǝna lan mara faltǝ dǝ ga ro fantǝro sadǝ fǝraksǝyin darenzǝ dǝ, kuru naa zamtǝna ro karǝngǝn lenǝma ma lardǝwa la so dǝ nyiya kolza mara ma fallǝmba.

sourceString: On certain itineraries there is a risk of getting quarantined somewhere along the way.
targetString: Zawalwa la so dǝn tajirwa nyiya kornǝm gǝnatǝ ye zawal dǝn mbeji.

sourceString: So book a direct flight if you can, and if not, think carefully about where to connect.
targetString: Adǝ nankaro mara kǝla tilowa ro sak lejin ma tai rangnǝmin ma, ngaigǝnyi ma, ngǝlaro tafakar diye kǝla ma mara faltǝ yen.

sourceString: In uncertain times, plans can change.
targetString: Loktu tawadǝba so lan, dawari so muwonzǝ faltin.

sourceString: Many embassies and consulates have evacuated nonessential staff, and some have shut down operations completely.
targetString: Embassy ya-a ofis lardǝ diya ye wakilzayin so-a kada cidamanza chidanza mbu gǝnyi ya so solodǝ kalaksana, la dǝye cetro zaksana.

sourceString: Emergency assistance should still be available, though it's possible you may have to contact a further-away consulate if your local one has shut down.
targetString: Bana duwasashi ye dǝ kwamison mbeji, dǝwo yayi ofis lardǝ diya ye wakilzayin so ma cintu bamin karǝngnǝm ye dǝ zakkata ma.

sourceString: If you have been stranded due to the pandemic, your nearest consulate may be able to help you find a flight home, arrange an emergency loan so you can buy a ticket, or provide an emergency passport.
targetString: Sa awo muskonǝm ye cot dajiya wawa dǝye sǝkǝ, ofis lardǝnǝmye nyin karǝngǝn ma dǝ raksǝ nyiya banazǝ mara fandimin, kusu duwasashi ye la nyiro dawarza tiket yiwumin, aw nyiro fasfot duwasashi ye dawarzayin.

sourceString: At the very least they can keep you informed about the local situation and notify you about recently introduced travel requirements and restrictions.
targetString: Gananzǝ yayi, nyiro hawar hal faton dǝanaye nzadin kuru nyiro bayan kǝla mǝradǝwa bǝlaro bǝlin-a kal-a yen sadin.

sourceString: Ordinary consular services such as visa and passport processing may be suspended or restricted to urgent need, depending on the location and the consulate.
targetString: Cidawa kun barin ye ofis lardǝ diya ye sadin so alama visa-a fasfot-a dawartǝ so dǝ dawartin aw kal tǝkin mǝradǝ duwasashi ye kalaktin, lǝatar-a ofis lardǝ diya dǝ-a ye ro.

sourceString: Although some people call the disease "Wuhan pneumonia" (武汉(漢)肺炎/武肺), "Wuhan disease", or "Chinese virus", the use of these terms is considered racist in China and by many people of Chinese origin.
targetString: Am la so ye kwasa dǝga "kwasa namusu ye Wuhan ye" lan buwozayin yayi (武汉(漢)肺炎/武肺), "kwasa Wuhan ye", aw ' kuli kwasabe China ye", Kalma adǝn faidatǝ dǝ China lan nǝm jili fǝletǝ yeyi ro turin am lardǝ China ye nguwu so ye.

sourceString: It is still common to refer the disease as "Wuhan pneumonia" or "Chinese virus" in places like Hong Kong and Taiwan.
targetString: Kwasa dǝga "kwasa namusu ye Wuhan ye" aw "kuli kwasabe China ye" lan buwotǝ dǝ bǝlawa Hong Kong-a Taiwan-a dǝn tǝlina.

sourceString: To be safe, use location-neutral terms when referring to the disease, such as "COVID-19", "novel coronavirus", or just "the virus" or "the pandemic".
targetString: Nǝlewa manǝm ma, kalmawa su naye suro dǝn ba so dǝn faidatǝne sa kwasa ngazanǝmiya, alama "COVID-19", "novel coronavirus", aw biya "the virus" aw "the pandemic" so yayi gulle.

sourceString: Particularly in developing countries where law enforcement are poorly trained, enforcement of curfew, lockdown or stay-at-home orders are often brutal, often using forces not proportionate against crowds.
targetString: Musamman ma ro lardǝwa citǝ sadin so dǝn na darewa so dǝ ngǝlaro allamtǝnyi sodǝn, fomno dabtǝ so, layi zaktǝ so, wuwom faton-nabtǝ so ye dǝ nguwu so nǝm kǝladowa, nguwu so ro duno samno dǝga sandǝnyi lan faidatayin.

sourceString: Comply with these orders, and avoid crowds in public.
targetString: Wuwomwa adǝ lan cidane, kuru samno jamayen cintune.

sourceString: As a result of the coronavirus pandemic, xenophobia has risen in many countries, primarily but not exclusively targeting people perceived to be Chinese.
targetString: Sawo wawa koronabairos ye dǝro, kusoto njutǝ so lardǝwa kadan tǝrana, buro hawal dǝn amma duk so gǝnyi am China ye ro tǝmata so dǝ dǝro bǝtǝrǝm tǝadǝna.

sourceString: There has been a worldwide spike in racist incidents targeting people of East Asian origin, including in major cities such as New York, London and San Francisco.
targetString: Dina samma son awowa kusoto njutǝ ye diwo baditǝna am East Asia ye nganzatǝ, suro dǝn bǝrniwa kura kura alama Newyork so, London so, San Francisco so mbeji.

sourceString: In Hong Kong, Sinophobia, which was already high to begin with, has intensified as a result of the pandemic, with the result that many shops and restaurants are now denying service to mainland Chinese customers and banning Mandarin speakers from their premises (with the exception of Taiwanese).
targetString: Suro Hong Kong yen, kusoto njutǝ dǝ shi dǝwo ne buroman nguwu dǝ, tǝrana sawo wawa dǝyen, naa kantiwa-a kǝmbu ladoye-a am China ye ro karayi sukulodayinmba kuru am tǝlam mandarin manazayinso wa kornzaro ga ro dabsana (am Taiwan ye dawun ba ro).

sourceString: Levels of xenophobia have also risen in East Asia, with some restaurants and other businesses in Japan and China refusing service to foreign customers.
targetString: East Asia yen kusoto njutǝ dǝ tǝrana, naa kǝmbu ladoye la so Japan-a China-a lan am lardǝ diya ye ro karayi lodo dabsana.

sourceString: In China, there have been incidents of foreigners being refused rooms by hotel staff, and foreign residents, particularly black people, being kicked out of their apartments on short notice by their landlords.
targetString: China lan, hawar isǝna kǝla cidawu hotel so ye am lardǝ diya ye so ro njim dabsana yen, kuru nabtuwu lardǝ diya ye so dǝ, musamman ma ro am sǝlǝm so dǝ sandiya fannza son duro tutuluwuna kǝma fatoma so ye.

sourceString: Sources for further information on the coronavirus outbreak include:
targetString: Naa nzǝray hawar ye fandoye kǝla falangtǝ koronabairos ye dǝ suro dǝn:

sourceString: The US government Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
targetString: Gomnati US ye ye cidaramnzǝ sha "Centers for Disease Control and Prevention" lan buwotin ma dǝ

sourceString: European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control (daily updates)
targetString: European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control (hawarra bǝlin yim wo son)

sourceString: United Kingdom government, - Foreign and Commonwealth Office advice for Travellers
targetString: Gomnati United Kingdom ye, - ofis shawari kǝnjo ye bǝlaroma so lardǝ diya-a lardǝwa Commonwealth -a

sourceString: An online map and dashboard from the John Hopkins University Center for Systems Science and Engineering with live updates
targetString: Online map -a dashboard -a na "John Hopkins University Center for Systems Science and Engineering" yen bayanna bǝlin kǝla fataro kǝnjo-a

sourceString: Partial lists of entry restrictions from IATA and The New York Times
targetString: Suwa la ga ro sabtǝna ye so IATA -a New York Times -a yen

sourceString: A variety of misinformation and conspiracy theories about the virus are being promoted online and even by some government officials, so be careful which sources you check for information.
targetString: Hawarra fǝrtǝ ba kad-a ci kǝl-a kǝla kui kwasabe dǝyen onlayin lan tarzayin hatta cidawu gomnati la so yen kunten ro, adǝ nankaro hangal genane fǝrtyi lan hawar so kulasnǝmin ro.

sourceString: Ensure that all information and advice you receive has been backed by reputable doctors and scientists.
targetString: Tawatkǝne kǝla bayanna-a shawariwa-a fanǝmin so dǝ liyitawa suwa so -a ilmuwu so-a ye tawatsana ro.

sourceString: In a crisis, it's natural to want to keep following the latest updates, but it may be better for your mental health to moderate the amount of news that you look at, and stick to reliable news sources.
targetString: Suro fitna ye so dǝn, hawarra bǝlin so matǝ so dǝ mbeji, amma nǝlefa hangalnǝm ye nankaro adadu hawarra fanǝmin ye so dǝ sangnǝmin, kuru fǝrtǝ hawarra mbǝrsheya so ye ro kǝrtǝgǝna.

sourceString: If you normally watch the news twice per day then stick to this schedule and do something else, rather than having the 24-hour news on continuously.
targetString: Buron ndi ro hawar fanǝmin ma daji loktu adǝ man dane awonǝm la gade de, susu awa 24 ro hawarra kǝrǝntǝ ye dǝro.

sourceString: b'Bat SARS-like coronavirus WIV1 (Bat SL-CoV-WIV1), also sometimes called SARS-like coronavirus WIV1, is a strain of Severe acute respiratory syndrome-related coronavirus (SARSr-CoV) isolated from Chinese rufous horseshoe bats (Rhinolophus sinicus).
targetString: b'Bat SARS-like coronavirus WIV1 (Bat SL-CoV-WIV1) dǝ, kuru man soku lan sha SARS-like coronavirus WIV1 lan buwotin dǝ, jili koronabairos kwasa yintǝ ye kǝraw ma ye (SARSr-CoV) tiyi batata China ye rufous horseshoe (Rhinolophus sinicus) dǝn gotǝna ma.

sourceString: Like all coronaviruses, virions consist of single-stranded positive-sense RNA enclosed within an envelope.
targetString: Coronavirus gade gabsǝna so dǝyeyi, kuli kwasabe suronzǝn single-stranded positive-sense RNA suro zaktǝram yen mbeji.

sourceString: The discovery confirms that bats are the natural reservoir of SARS-CoV.
targetString: Kulashi ye fǝlezǝna kǝla batata so dǝ sandima ba sabtǝram SARS-CoV ye alayeme ye wo ro.

sourceString: Phylogenetic analysis shows the possibility of direct transmission of SARS from bats to humans without the intermediary Chinese civets, as previously believed.
targetString: Kulashi Phylogenetic ye ye fǝlezǝna kǝla muwonzǝ SARS dǝ batata men adamngana ro kǝla tilowa ro falyin yen kate kate dǝn Chinese civets so ba ro, futu buron gotǝna dǝyeyi.

sourceString: b'COVID-19 drug development is the research process to develop a preventative vaccine or therapeutic prescription drug that would alleviate the severity of 2019-20 coronavirus disease (COVID-19).
targetString: b'COVID-19 drug development də shima duluwu kulashibe kalimi kaltəgəbe au kurun do nəm zau kwasa koronabairosbe saa 2019-20 (COVID-19) də kəske ro sədin tandobe.

sourceString: The International Clinical Trials Registry Platform of the WHO recorded 536 clinical studies to develop post-infection therapies for COVID-19 infections, with numerous established antiviral compounds for treating other infections under clinical research to be repurposed.
targetString: Ngərwowa Jarabtəwa Litaribe Bafro Ikkobe shiro "The International Clinical Trials Registry Platform" sayin WHOye dəye kəra litaribe sandi 536 kurunna ngawo kwasabe kamma sətanabe kwasa COVID-19be nankaro tando ro, kurunna kuli kwasabeye noata kwasa'a gade ro kurun diobe kada litarin kulastinna waltəm sandiya awo gade ro faidatə ro.

sourceString: In March, the WHO initiated the "SOLIDARITY Trial" in 10 countries, enrolling thousands of people infected with COVID-19 to assess treatment effects of four existing antiviral compounds with the most promise of efficacy.
targetString: Kəntagə Marchbe lan, WHOye awo shiro "SOLIDARITY Trial" sayin də badiyono suro lardəwa 10be lan, am duwu kada COVID-19ye sətana gozəna faidawa kurunna kuli kwasabe caman mbeji sowanda nanka ro, wadə faidajinbe zauro kura'a ma.

sourceString: A dynamic, systematic review was established in April 2020 to track the progress of registered clinical trials for COVID-19 vaccine and therapeutic drug candidates.Vaccine and drug development is a multistep process, typically requiring more than five years to assure safety and efficacy of the new compound.
targetString: Kəntagə Aprilbe saa 2020ye lan kulashi mbərshe-aye kuru fasallaye baktəna fuwutə jarabtə litaribe bafro təkkəna am kalimi COVID-19be-a kurunzə-a sandi ro tədinbe kənga ro. Kalimi-a kuru-a tando də duluwu katap kada-a, ngəlama ro saa uwu ma kozəna məradəzəna awo tənandəna bəlin dəye nəlewanzə-a faidatənzə-a tawattəgə ro.

sourceString: Drug development is the process of bringing a new infectious disease vaccine or therapeutic drug to the market once a lead compound has been identified through the process of drug discovery.
targetString: Kurun tando də shima duluwu kalimi au kurun kwasa kam ro faltəyin bəlin ro suluwunabe kasuwu ro kudobe sa awo laa fuwu gərjin duluwu kurun tandobe dən asutiya.

sourceString: It includes laboratory research on microorganisms and animals, filing for regulatory status, such as via the FDA, for an investigational new drug to initiate clinical trials on humans, and may include the step of obtaining regulatory approval with a new drug application to market the drug.
targetString: Suro dən kulashi kəla kuliwa shimbe surimba-a dabbawa-a yen njim ngal dioben dio mbeji, kənda balastəbe au amari matabe mbeji, misal ro FDA futa men, kurun kulashi diobe bəlinye kəla adammana soyen jarabtə baditə nankaro, kuru suro dən katap amari kurun bəlin kasuwu lan faidatəbe au kasuwu ro ikkobe fandoye mbeji.

sourceString: Development of a COVID-19 vaccine or therapeutic antiviral drug begins with matching a chemical concept to the potential prophylactic mechanism of the future vaccine or antiviral activity in vivo.
targetString: Kalimi COVID-19be au kurun kuli yezobe tando də baditin sa bayanna kimiyabe laa-a duluwuwa kalimi dəye kwasa kəriujin au cidawanzə kuli kwasabe gərtəbe-a gəretə lan.

sourceString: New chemical entities (NCEs, also known as new molecular entities or NMEs) are compounds that emerge from the process of drug discovery to specify a vaccine or antiviral candidate.
targetString: Kemikalla bəlin sandiya (NCE au NME) lan notəna sandi ma awowa do duluwu kurun bəlin fodutəye men soluyinma kalimi laa au kurun kuli kwasabe laa'a taganas ro bayanzayin ma.

sourceString: These have promising activity against a biological target related to COVID-19 disease.
targetString: Sandi anyi cida ngəla kəla taranowa awo ro-a kwasa COVID-19be'a leyataye kəlan sadinye wadə mbeji.

sourceString: At the beginning of vaccine or drug development, little is known about the safety, toxicity, pharmacokinetics, and metabolism of the NCE in humans.
targetString: Badiyaram kalimi au kurun tandobe lan, awo gana noata wo k3la Nəlewa-a, asəm-a, futu cidajin-a, kuru NCEwa dəga tiyi adammanabe lan fasaljin-aye kəlan.

sourceString: It is the function and obligation of drug development to assess all of these parameters prior to human clinical trials to prove safety and efficacy.
targetString: Adə shima cida kurun tandobe wo kuru mbu ro walzəna awowa anyi samma so kulastə də kau adammana lan jarabtin də ro, nəlewa-a faidatə-a tawattəgə ro.

sourceString: A further major objective of drug development is to recommend the dose and schedule for the first use in a human clinical trial ("first-in-human" [FIH] or First Human Dose [FHD], previously also known as "first-in-man" [FIM]).
targetString: Məradə kurun tandoe kura gade də shima nəm ngəwu-a loktu-a do kurun də buro salakyen tiyi adammanaben jarabtin də gultə, awo do shiro ("first-in-human" [FIH] au First Human Dose [FHD] gulzayin də, buronna "first-in-man" [FIM]) lan nogatə.

sourceString: In addition, drug development must establish the physicochemical properties of the NCE: its chemical makeup, stability, and solubility.
targetString: Adə ro nzəra lan, kurun tando lan awo shiro "physicochemical properties" sayin NCEwa dəye koktə də mbu: kemikalla tiyi dən dəgana so, faltə baanzə so, kuru yitənzə-a.

sourceString: Manufacturers must optimize the process they use to make the chemical so they can scale up from a medicinal chemist producing milligrams, to manufacturing on the kilogram and ton scale.
targetString: Kurun tandoma so də duluwu faidata kemikal sanandin də ngalwo ro dio də sandi ro mbu ro walzəna, am kurun kemisbe gana gana tando ma lan ciza kamfani kilo-a ton-a satandin ro walza nanka ro.

sourceString: They further examine the product for suitability to package as capsules, tablets, aerosol, intramuscular injectable, subcutaneous injectable, or intravenous formulations.
targetString: Daji awo satandəna də walta napsa futu fato ro sakkiya sandəna də wuzayin, misal ro kapsol, tablet (kwaya), fəttəgəbe, da ro liula lan ikkobe, cidiya katiyibe ro liula lan ikkobe, au tandowa cau ro ikkobe.

sourceString: Together, these processes are known in preclinical and clinical development as chemistry, manufacturing, and control (CMC).Many aspects of drug development focus on satisfying the regulatory requirements of drug licensing authorities.
targetString: Na fal lan, duluwuwa anyi fuwutə ilmu kau-litariye wo-a ilmu litaribe-a lan sandiga kimiyya "chemistry", tando, kuru noto au cistəgə-a lan nogatə.Alamawa au nashawa fuwutə kurunbe ngəwu so hangal məradəwa notobe huwumawa lasis kurunbeye kurnotə ro sadəna.

sourceString: These generally constitute tests designed to determine the major toxicities of a novel compound prior to first use in humans.
targetString: Anyibe suron mbeji ngalla do asəm awowa bəlin buron tiyi adammanabe ro təkkənyi asuta nanka ro tənandəna ma.

sourceString: The Canadian government announced CA$275 million in funding for 96 research projects on medical countermeasures against COVID-19, including numerous vaccine candidates at Canadian universities, with plans to establish a "vaccine bank" of new vaccines for implementation if another coronavirus outbreak occurs.
targetString: Gomnati Canadabeye kunguna "CA$275 million" dola Canadabe miliyon 275 kulashiwa kəla COVID-19 kəriutəe sandi 96 ro cejin sə warmazəna, kalimiwa kada jam'ia Canadaben kunten, kuru fasal au dawari bankə kalimibe koktabe kunten, shi doni waniye waltə koronabairos fəlangjiya faidatin ma.

sourceString: Clinical trial programs involve three, multiple-year stages toward product approval, and a fourth, post-approval stage for ongoing safety monitoring of the vaccine or drug therapy:
targetString: Faraskəramwa jarabtə liaribe də suronzən katapwa yakkə, saa kada'a mbeji awo tənandəna kasada fando ro, kuru katap kən diyeumi, ngawo kasada tuwandənayen, kalimi au kurun ninitəgəbe do letə sədin ma də.

sourceString: Phase I trials, usually in healthy volunteers, determine safety and dosing.
targetString: Katap jarabtəbe kən tilo mi, ngəwu so ro am kəlanzəkko ma nga so lan, nəlewa-a adadu gotinna fodujin.

sourceString: Phase II trials are used to establish an initial reading of efficacy and further explore safety in small numbers of people having the disease targeted by the NCE.
targetString: Katap jarabtəbe kən indi mi də faidatə ruo faidatənzəbe burobe koktə ro tədin kuru nzəliwo suro adadu gana laa am kwasa NCEbe tarajin də tiyinzan mbeji kuru ro

sourceString: Phase III trials are large, pivotal trials to determine safety and efficacy in sufficiently large numbers of people with the COVID-19 infection.
targetString: Jarabtəwa katap kən yakkə me də sandi kura ye, jarabtə toli ma do nzəliwo-a faidatə-a fodujin ma suro adadu am kwasa COVID-19ye sətana ngəwu yen.

sourceString: If safety and efficacy are adequately proved, clinical testing may stop at this step and the NCE advances to the new drug application (NDA) stage to begin marketing.
targetString: Nəlewa/nzəliwo-a faidatə-a kalkal ro kasada sowandəna maa, katap adə lan jarabtə kitaribe mowonzə rotin kuru NCE də katap "new drug application" be ro fuwuzə kojin, kasuwu ro ikko baditə nanka ro.

sourceString: Phase IV trials are post-approval trials that may be a condition attached by the FDA, also called post-market surveillance studies.
targetString: Jarabtəwa katap kən diyeumi də sandima katapwa ngawo kasada tuwandənabe ma do ka'ida FDAye kəlzəgəna ro waljin, shi doni "post-market surveillance studies".

sourceString: In addition to the tests required to move a novel vaccine or antiviral drug into the clinic for the first time, manufacturers must ensure that any long-term or chronic toxicities are well-defined, including effects on systems not previously monitored (fertility, reproduction, immune system, among others).
targetString: Ngalla do kalimi bəlin au kurun kuli kwasabe bəlin litari ro buro salakro ikko ro məradətəna də ro nzəra lan, kurun tandoma so ro mbu ro walzəna nəm asəmma loktu kuruwube au zauro zau ma wo so ngəla ro bayantəna ro, suro dən mbeji ngənəwuwa kəla nzunduwa buron ninitəgənyi soyen ( raktə kənzambibe, kənzambi, nzundu tiyibe kwasa gərtəbe, gabsənanza so'a).

sourceString: In the United States, this process is called a "new drug application" or NDA.
targetString: United States lan, duluwu adə ro "new drug application" au NDA gulzayin.

sourceString: A clinical trial design in progress may be modified as an "adaptive design" if accumulating data in the trial provide early insights about positive or negative efficacy of the treatment.
targetString: Tando jarabtə litaribe dio tədin də mowonzə naptə "adaptve design" au tando gotabe ro ngalwo təyin, sapsawi bayanbe suro jarabtəyen saptə də basira datebe kəla nəm ngəla au nəm diwi kurun dio shima dəye notə cin maa.

sourceString: The global Solidarity and European Discovery trials of hospitalized people with severe COVID-19 infection apply adaptive design to rapidly alter trial parameters as results from the four experimental therapeutic strategies emerge.
targetString: Jarabtəwa dunyabe "Solidarity and European Discovery'ye am litari lan rotəna sandiya kwasa COVID-19be zau dəye sətana ro "adaptive design" faidata lamarra jarabtəbe lezaro, tamoramwa jarabtəwa diyeu dəye luwo sədin lan.

sourceString: Adaptive designs within ongoing Phase II-III clinical trials on candidate therapeutics may shorten trial durations and use fewer subjects, possibly expediting decisions for early termination or success, and coordinating design changes for a specific trial across its international locations.
targetString: Tandowa gotabe au "adaptive design" suro jarabtəwa litaribe katap II - III letə sədin ma kəla kurun kam dondi ro dioben ye də loktu jarabtəye də fulujin kuru am gana faidatin, shawariwa daten rotəbe au kənasarbe lejin, kuru faltə tandowabe fasaljin jarabtə laa taganasbe ro dərinəm kəlle dunyabe lan.

sourceString: Most novel drug candidates (NCEs) fail during drug development, either because they have unacceptable toxicity or because they simply do not prove efficacy on the targeted disease, as shown in Phase II-III clinical trials.
targetString: NCEya ngəwu so loktu fuwutə au ngalwotəgə kurunbe ye lan sakkuruyin, dalil nəm ngəwu asəmzabe yen au təmmaro kwasa shima də ro faidazayimba nanka ro, futu katapwa jarabtəbe kən II - III fəlezana yedei.

sourceString: The high failure rates associated with pharmaceutical development are referred to as an "attrition rate", requiring decisions during the early stages of drug development to "kill" projects early to avoid costly failures.
targetString: Nəm ngəwu ikkurobe ngalwotəgə farmasibe'a leyata də sha "attrition rate" lan bowotin, katapwa kurun tandobe badiyarambe dən shawari cida də yezobe gotə məradəzəna ikkuro zauro kunguna basartə'a ro katə nankaro.

sourceString: One 2010 study assessed both capitalized and out-of-pocket costs for bringing a single new drug to market as about US$1.8 billion and $870 million, respectively.
targetString: Kulashi saa 2010be laaye taman gəna'ata-a liu lan suluyin-a kurun fal long kassuwu ro tulobe ndi so kushezə suruna, kuru alama dola Americabe biliyon 1.8-a kuru dola miliyon 870 kalkal wono.

sourceString: A median cost estimate of 2015-16 trials for development of 10 anti-cancer drugs was $648 million.
targetString: Som taman daube jarabtəwa saa 2015-16 kurun kansabe sandi 10 tandobe də dola miliyon 648.

sourceString: In a 2016 review of 106 drug candidates assessed through clinical trials, the total capital expenditure for a manufacturer having a drug approved through successful Phase III trials was $2.6 billion (in 2013 dollars), an amount increasing at an annual rate of 8.5%.
targetString: Suro nazaru saa 2016 am 106 kurun sandi lan litarin jarabtənabe lan, som darebe kurun tandoma ye cejin ngawo kurun də kasattənayen jarabtə katap kən yakkəme kənasarraye men də shima dola biliyon 2.6 (dola 2013 be lan), adadu do saa wo son ci 8.5% lan tərayin ma.

sourceString: Seven trials were evaluating repurposed drugs already approved to treat malaria, including four studies on hydroxychloroquine or chloroquine phosphate.
targetString: Jarabtəwa sandi tulur kurunna malariabe awo gade ro faidatə ro matin waltana wuzayin, surodən kəra kəla "hydroxychloroquine" au chloroquine "phosphatebe" kəlan tədəna mbeji

sourceString: Repurposed antiviral drugs make up most of the Chinese research, with 9 Phase III trials on remdesivir across several countries due to report by the end of April.
targetString: Kurun kuli kwasabe awo gade ro waltəm faidatə də shima kulashi China be sədin ngəwu so, jarabtə katap III sandi 9 kəla remdesivir ben tədəna dərinəm kəlle lardəwa kadayen, bayanzə datəgəram Aprilbe lan suluyin.

sourceString: Led by the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation with partners investing US$125 million and coordinating with the World Health Organization, the COVID-19 Therapeutics Accelerator began in March, facilitating drug development researchers to rapidly identify, assess, develop, and scale up potential treatments.
targetString: Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation fuwu gǝrjinna ro kuru sawaa mukko kǝltabe kunguna dola miliyon US$125 zar ro dinayin kuru karapka nǝlewbe dunyabe-a fantayin ro, awo shiro "COVID-19 Therapeutics Accelerator" sayin dǝ kǝntagǝ Marchbe lan badiyatǝ, kulashiwu kurun tandobe so'a banazǝgǝ duwaro kurun dio asuza, kulassa, ngalwoza, kuru hapsaa.

sourceString: The COVID-19 Clinical Research Coalition formed to coordinate and expedite results from international clinical trials on the most promising post-infection treatments.
targetString: Ngawana kəla kulashi litaribe COVID-19be kokkatə tamoramwa jarabtəwa dunyabe fasaltə-a kuru letənzə azallata ro dio-a kəla kurun dio zaurofaidajin ro wutin ngawo kamma kwasaye sətana yen.

sourceString: In early 2020, numerous established antiviral compounds for treating other infections were being repurposed or developed in new clinical research efforts to alleviate the illness of COVID-19.
targetString: Badiyaram saa 2020 ben, kurunna kuli kwasabe gərzayin kwasa gade so ro faidazayin kada walta awo bəlin ro faidajin ro tədəna au ngalwotəgəna suro ngənəwuwa kulashi litaribe ye kwasa COVID-19be ba ro dio nanka ro.

sourceString: For an already-approved drug (such as hydroxychloroquine for malaria), Phase III-IV trials determine in hundreds to thousands of COVID-19-infected people the possible extended use of an already-approved drug for treating COVID-19 infection.
targetString: Kurun burotə amari tina au kasattəna (jili hydroxychloroquine kange maleriabe ro sasayin də) ro, jarabtəwa katap kən III-IV dəye səkkə faida kurun caman COVID-19 ro kurun dio ro amari tina ye notin tiyi am COVID-19be sətana duwu kadabe lan.

sourceString: As of early April 2020, 103 candidate therapeutics were in preclinical or a stage of Phase I-IV development, with trial results for 29 drug candidates expected during April.
targetString: Kəntagə Aprilbe saa 2020 ben badiyaramnzən, a, 103 kurun tədin ma sandi kau litari wo lan au katap suro katapwa I-IV ngalwotəgəben, tamoramwa kurun jarabtəbe am 29 suro Aprilben təmatəna'a.

sourceString: In March, the World Health Organization (WHO) launched the coordinated "Solidarity trial" in 10 countries to rapidly assess in thousands of COVID-19 infected people the potential efficacy of existing antiviral and anti-inflammatory agents not yet evaluated specifically for COVID-19 illness.
targetString: Suro kəntagə Marchbe lan, WHOye "Solidarity trial" fasallata ma də citulo suro lardəwa 10ye lan duwa ro tiyi am COVID-19ye sətana duwu kadabe lan faidatə kurunna kuli kwasabe-a kurun futə be-a caman mbejiye kulasnəm notə ro, kurunna anyi COVID-19 ro faidatənzə kuwa yaye kulastənyi.

sourceString: Do any of the drugs reduce mortality?
targetString: Kurunna anyi falnza yaye kərmu fulujin wa?

sourceString: Do any of the drugs reduce the time a patient is hospitalized?
targetString: Kurunna anyiye suro lan falnza yaye loktu kam dondi'a litarin rotin fulujin wa?

sourceString: Do the treatments affect the need for people with COVID-19-induced pneumonia to be ventilated or maintained in intensive care?
targetString: Kurun dio dəye məradəwa am tiyinzan nimoniya COVID-19ye səsangəna injin yintəbeye au na kam zauro dondi ro cistəgəbe ro sandiya ikkobe lezəna wa?

sourceString: Could such drugs be used to minimize the illness of COVID-19 infection in healthcare staff and people at high risk of developing severe illness?Enrolling people with COVID-19 infection is simplified by using data entries, including informed consent, on a WHO website.
targetString: Kurunna jili anyi mowonzə faidatə nəm dondi kwasa COVID-19be dau cidawu nəlewabe-a am zauro suro fujiwo donditəyen kasharu so fulutin wa? Am kwasa COVID-19be'a ikko də sapsawi bayanbe təkkəna faidatəye kəskezəgəna, kasada gullata'an kunten ro, kəla websayit WHObe lan.

sourceString: After the trial staff determines the drugs available at the hospital, the WHO website randomizes the hospitalized subject to one of the trial drugs or to the hospital standard of care for treating COVID-19.
targetString: Ngawo jarabtə yen cidama ye kurunna do litari dən mbeji də nojin, websayit WHObe ye kam litarin rotəna də'a kurunna jarabtə fal də'a kəljin au nəm ngalwo litari dəye COVID-19be kurun dioye.

sourceString: The trial physician records and submits follow-up information about the subject status and treatment, completing data input via the WHO Solidarity website.
targetString: Liyita jarabtəbe dəye bayanna ngawo kəngabe kəla kəndaram kam dəbe-a kurun shiro dio-ayen ruojinye kuru saadinye, sapsawi bayanbe ikko websayit WHO Solidarity men tamojin.

sourceString: A global safety monitoring board of WHO physicians examine interim results to assist decisions on safety and effectiveness of the trial drugs, and alter the trial design or recommend an effective therapy.
targetString: Majilas ninitaabe liyitawa WHObe dunyabe ye tamoramwa loktu ganabe soru bananza nasha shawari kəla nəlewa-a faidatə kurun jarabtəbe dəye-a yen sadin, kuru futu jarabtə tədin də falzayin au shawari kurun dio faidajin gadebe sadin.

sourceString: A similar web-based study to Solidarity, called "Discovery", was initiated in March across seven countries by INSERM (Paris, France).During March, funding for the Solidarity trial reached US$108 million from 203,000 individuals, organizations and governments, with 45 countries involved in financing or trial management.
targetString: Kəra au nazaru adəga samun 'Solidarity'be web furtunzə wo ma, shiro "Discovery" sayin də, kəntagə Marchbe lan dərinəm kəlle lardəwa tulurbe lan INSERM (Paris, France) ye badiyono. Suro kəntagə Marchbe lan, jarabtə "Solidarity"be kunguna tuwandəna də dola miliyon 108 nazəgəna na am so, karapkawa so, kuru gomnatiwa soyen, lardəwa 45 kunguna yezo au jarabtə ro cistaa kəla ro gozana'a

sourceString: Numerous candidate drugs under study as "supportive" treatments to relieve discomfort during illness, such as NSAIDs or bronchodilators, are not included in the table below.
targetString: Kurunna kada kəratə tədin ma naptə kurun dio "banazəyin ma" ye kuttu fantə suro nəm dondiye haptə nanka ro, misal ro NSAIDs so au kurun yintə kəsketəgəbe "bronchodilator" sayin də, sandiya tewur cidiyabe də ro təkkənyi.

sourceString: Others in early-stage Phase II trials or numerous treatment candidates in Phase I trials, are also excluded.
targetString: Gade suro badiyaram katap II jarabtəbe au am sandi ro kurun tədin suro katap I jarabtəbe kadaye suro dən ba.

sourceString: Drug candidates in Phase I-II trials have a low rate of success (under 12%) to pass through all trial phases to gain eventual approval.
targetString: Am sandi lan kurun jarabtin suro katap jarabtəbe I-II'a ye də alama kənasar sadə (cidiya 12% yen) katapwa jarabtəbe samma koza kasada sowandinye də zauro gana.

sourceString: Hydroxychloroquine is more commonly available than chloroquine in the United States.
targetString: Hydroxychloroquine də shima fandonzə kəske wo "chloroquine" yaye ro United States lan.

sourceString: Although several countries use chloroquine or hydroxychloroquine for treatment of persons hospitalized with COVID-19, as of March 2020 the drug has not been formally approved through clinical trials in the United States.
targetString: Lardəwa kada "chloroquine au hydroxychloroquine" am COVID-19ye sətana ro sandi lan faidatana kurun sadin yaye, kəntagə Marchbe saa 2020 lan kurun də noata ro kasattənyi jarabtə litaribe men suro United Statesye lan.

sourceString: Chloroquine has been recommended by Chinese, South Korean and Italian health authorities for the treatment of COVID-19, although these agencies and the US CDC noted contraindications for people with heart disease or diabetes.
targetString: Huwumawa Chinabe-a, South Koreabe-a kuru Italybe-a ye shawari "chloroquine" faidatəm COVID-19be kurun diobe sadəna, huwumawa anyi-a US CDC-a ye am kwasa karəgəbe-a shuwurbe-a ro wande faidatanyi sana yaye.

sourceString: Both drugs have extensive interactions with prescription drugs, affecting the therapeutic dose and disease mitigation.
targetString: Kurunna indi so zauro duno'a ro kurunna liyitabe ruozəna am soye caman sasayinna yeltayin, nəm ngəwu kurun dəye ngatə nankaro tayin dəye lejin kuru kwasa dəye kəskezəyin.

sourceString: Some people have allergic reactions to these drugs.On 12 April, a preliminary clinical trial conducted at a hospital in Brazil was stopped when several people given high doses of chloroquine for COVID-19 infection developed irregular heart rates, causing 11 deaths.
targetString: Am laa kurunna sandima də tiyinzaye waano. Kəntagə Aprilbe kaunzə 12nna, jarabtə litaribe badiyarambe litari laa Brazilbe lan tədəna də roatə sa am sandi ro chloroquine kwasa COVID-19be nankaro ngəwu ro sadəna kada baktə karəgəbe kalkal gənyi badiyada, adəye səkkə am 11 baza.
