sourceString: Chinese clinical trials in Wuhan and Shenzhen claimed to show that favipiravir was "clearly effective".
targetString: Jarabtəwa litaribe Chinabe Wuhan-a Shenzhen-a lan tədəna dəye fəlezəna kurun "favipiravir" də "zauro faidazəna"wada.

sourceString: Of 35 patients in Shenzhen tested negative in a median of 4 days, while the length of illness was 11 days in the 45 patients who did not receive it.
targetString: Shenzhen lan am 35 sandiya ngaltə tiyinzan ba ro turuna suro kau 4 yen, amma loktu nəm dondi dəye am dondi 45 do sandiro kurun də sadənyi maye də kau 11.

sourceString: In a study conducted in Wuhan on 240 patients with pneumonia half were given favipiravir and half received umifenovir.
targetString: Kulashi Wuhan lan kəla am dondi tiyinzan nimoniya'a sandi 240 yen tədəna, retanza ro "favipiravir" sadə kuru reta də ro "umifenovir" sadə.

sourceString: The term "preclinical research" is defined by laboratory studies in vitro and in vivo, indicating a beginning stage for development of a vaccine, antiviral or monoclonal antibody therapy, such as experiments to determine effective doses and toxicity, before a candidate compound is advanced for safety and efficacy evaluation in humans.
targetString: Jumla "preclinical research" də shima kəra'a lab lan tədin diya lan au tiyi dabba yen ma də wo, adəye fvlejin katap badiyaram kalimi tandobe-a, kurun dio "antiviral or monoclonal antibody"be-a, misal jarabtəwa do nəm ngəwu kurunbe kam ro tin ma-a kuru nəm asəmmanzə-a notə nankaro tədin-a, kau kompawund laa fuwu ro taadə nazaru kvla nəlewa-a faidatənzə-a tiyi adammanben turin ro.

sourceString: Some antibiotics may be repurposed as COVID-19 treatments:
targetString: Kurunna kwasabe laa so də mowonzə sandiya kurun COVID-19be dio ro faidatin.

sourceString: In March 2020, the main protease of the SARS-CoV-2 virus was identified as a target for post-infection drugs.
targetString: Suro kəntagə Marchbe saa 2020e lan, "protease" kura kuli kwasabe SARS-CoV-2be də sha tarano kuruna ngawo kamma kwasabe sətanaye ro asutəna.

sourceString: This enzyme is essential to the host cell to reproduce the ribonucleic acid of the virus.
targetString: Awo shiro "enzyme"sayin adə sel sototəma də ro nasha "ribonucleic acid" kuli kwasabe tandoyen zauro faidajin.

sourceString: To find the enzyme, scientists used the genome published by Chinese researchers in January 2020 to isolate the main protease.
targetString: Enzyme də fando nankaro, ilmuwube "genome" doni kuashiwu Chinabe ye kəntagə January saa 2020be lan baksana də faidata "proteasə" də tulo nankaro

sourceString: As a potential combination therapy, they are used together in two Phase III arms of the 2020 global Solidarity project on COVID-19.
targetString: Naptə kurun dio na fal ro kəllatabe dən, sandiya rokko suro mukkowa indi katap kən III me "2020 global Solidarity project on COVID-19" ye lan faida'atə.

sourceString: A preliminary study in China of combined lopinavir and ritonavir found no effect in people hospitalized for COVID-19.
targetString: Kəra badiyarambe China lan tədəna ma lopinavir-a ritonavir-a kəlza am dondi COVID-19ye səta litarin bozana faidazənyi.

sourceString: It is unclear yet whether conditions arising during pregnancy including diabetes, cardiac failure, hypercoagulability or hypertension might represent additional risk factors for pregnant people as they do for nonpregnant people.From the limited data available, vertical transmission during the third trimester probably does not occur, or only occurs very rarely.
targetString: Lamarra nəlewabe sa kamu surowa maa cizayin jili kwasa shuwur so, karəgə ngəla ro cidajimba so, tuttə zawal bu ye na'a kozəna au kəmba bu ye so dəye fujiwo gade kamuwa surowa ro suwudin la suwudimba futu am ngai ro suwudin də ro də kuwa yaye asutənyi. Sapsawi bayanbe gana mbeji dən, faltəgə daatala suro kəntagə yakkə darebe dən wakajimba wo, au duwan wakajimba wo.

sourceString: There is no data yet on early pregnancy.
targetString: Sapsawi bayanbe kəla badiyaram suro be lan ba.

sourceString: Little evidence exists to permit any solid conclusions about the nature of COVID-19 infection in pregnancy.
targetString: Shada gana dəga shi doni kolzə jili kwasa COVID-19be loktu kamu surowa be ye kəlan awo fal kət gultin ma də.

sourceString: A case series of 43 women from New York who tested positive for COVID-19 showed similar patterns to non-pregnant adults: 86% had mild disease, 9.3% had severe disease and 4.7% developed critical disease.
targetString: New York lan kessa au lamarra zatata kamuwa 43be samma COVID-19 tiyinzan mbeji də jili kwasanzabe də ammurawa suro ba'a ye'a samun: suronzan ci 86% də gana kwasa də mbeji, ci 9.3% də zauro kwasa də mbeji, kuru ci 4.7% də taidazə kwasanza zau ro walzəna.

sourceString: Fetal distress was reported in two.
targetString: Tada surobe kəndanzə kuttuye bayan indi tuwandəna.

sourceString: None of the women developed severe COVID-19 pneumonia or died.
targetString: Suro kamuwa dəyen fal ma nimoniya COVID-19be sandiya sətana au bazəna ba.

sourceString: All of them had live birth pregnancies and no severe neonatal asphyxia was observed.
targetString: Sandi samma futu noata men isa ceshombo kuru mutə ngawo kənzambiye zauro zau turunyi.

sourceString: The samples of breast milk, amniotic fluid, cord blood and neonatal throat swab were tested for SARS-CoV-2, and all results were negative.In another study on 15 pregnant women, majority of the patients presented with fever and cough, while laboratory tests yielded lymphocytopenia in 12 patients.
targetString: Samfərwa cam nganjibe-a, nji tadarambe-a, bu kənzabe-a kuru samfvr nguwaltobe tini ngawo kənzambiyen gotəna dəye SARS-CoV-2 ro ngaltəna kuru tamoramwa samma soye ba fəlezəna. Kəra laa gade kəla kamuwa surowa sandi 15yen tədəna lan, ngəwunza so kange-a kasau-a sandiya sətana, kuru ngalla labye "lymphocytopenia" tiyi sandi 12 yen fəlewono.

sourceString: Computed tomography findings of these patients were consistent with previous reports of non-pregnant patients, consisting of ground-glass opacities at early stage.
targetString: Awowa foto nasha nasha be kompiutabe am dondi anyi be lan tuwandəna am dondi suro baa ye burobe'a kalkalzəna, sandi doni suronzan badiyaram lan kalwa yedei turin.

sourceString: Follow-up images after delivery showed no progression of pneumonia.Media reports indicate that over 100 women with COVID-19 might have delivered, and in March 2020, no maternal deaths were reported.
targetString: Fotowa ngawo kənzambiyen gotəna ye nimoniya ba fəlezəna. Bayanna fatowa hawarbe soye fəlezana kamuwa 100 samin tiyinzan COVID-19'a sasambəna, kuru suro kəntagə March saa 2020be lan, kərmu kənzambi'a leyata fal ma tuwandənyi.

sourceString: Their guidelines thus advise that any pregnant person admitted to hospital with a COVID-19 infection should receive at least 10 days of prophylactic low-molecular-weight heparin after being discharged from the hospital.
targetString: Kashimowanza dəye shawari cina kam surowa jiliwi yaye litarin sha rozana tiyinzən kwasa COVID-19be'a də gananzə yaye kau 10 ro kurun shiro "prophylactic low-molecular-weight heparin" gulzayin də gozə, ngawo litarin salamzana yen.

sourceString: There are no data yet concerning the implications of COVID-19 infections for labour.
targetString: Sapsawi bayanbe ba kəla kazəyiwa kwasa COVID-19be sa nzaruwu wakajiya suwudin yen ba.

sourceString: One infant girl born to a mother with COVID-19 had elevated IgM levels two hours after birth, suggesting that she had been infected in utero and supporting the possibility of vertical transmission in some cases.
targetString: Fero kəli kamu COVID-19-a ye sambəna laa də tiyinzən IgM ngəwu wo no ngawo awa indi yen, adəye fəlejin kwasa dəye suro tadaramben sha cita kuru mowontə faltəgə daatalabe ye ngawo sətayin lamarra laan.

sourceString: A small study involving 6 confirmed COVID-19 mothers showed no indication of SARS-COV-19 in their newborns' throats or serum but antibodies were present in neonatal blood sera samples, including IgM in two of the infants.
targetString: Kəra gana laa kamuwa tada kəli tiyinzan COVID-19-a ro tawattəgəna sandi 6'a tədəna də ye alama SARS-CoV-2 ye suro nguwalto au bu nduli kəli dəyen fəlezənyi amma awowa kwasa gərtəbe suro samfər bu ngawo kənzambi ye dən mbeji, IgM suro nduli kəli indi yen kunten.

sourceString: This is not usually passed from mother to fetus so further research is required to know whether the virus crossed the placenta or whether placentas of women in the study were damaged or abnormal.
targetString: Adə ya lan ci zə tada ro kojimba wo ngai dən, adəye səkkə kulashi gade məradətəna kuli kwasabe də kənza də farzə wa kowono au kənza kamuwa dəye də batti au kalkal gənyi ro notə nanka ro

sourceString: Since COVID-19 shows similarities to SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, it is likely that their effect on pregnancy are similar.
targetString: COVID-19 ye nəm samun SARS-CoV-a MERS-CoV-a fəlejin daa, futu surowa lezayin dəye mowonzə samun ro waljin.

sourceString: Four of seven had first trimester miscarriage, two of five had fetal growth restriction in the second trimester, and four of five had preterm birth.
targetString: Diyeu suro tulurbe lan suro kəntagə yakkə burobe lan suronza fiyatə, indi suro uwube lan wuratə baa tada surobe sandiya cuwando suro kəntagəwa yakkə kən indime dən, kuru diyeu suro uwuben kau sartənza wo ro ceshambo.

sourceString: None of the newborns were infected with SARS-CoV.
targetString: Nduli kəli tambo bəlinna də falnza ma SARS-CoV ye sandiya sətana ba.

sourceString: A report of ten cases of MERS- CoV infection in pregnancy in Saudi Arabia showed that the clinical presentation is variable, from mild to severe infection.
targetString: Bayan kessa kwasa MERS-CoVye sandi meu Saudi Arabiaye fəlezəna kwasa də tiyi ndu ye son gade gade, gana ngalau lan səta zauro zau ro saadəna.

sourceString: The outcome was favorable in a majority of the cases, but the infant death rate was 27%.A recent review suggested that COVID-19 appeared to be less lethal to mothers and infants than SARS and MERS but that there may be an increased risk of preterm birth after 28 weeks' gestation.
targetString: Tamoram də kessa ngəwu son kəji, amma kərmu tada kəlibe də ci 27% ma sətəna. Nazaru laa karungu ro tədəna ye fəlezəna COVID-19 də shima kamuwa-a nduli-a cejimba wo SARS-a MERS-a ro wungəmmiya, amma fujiwo kura kawu sartə wo ro yembo ye mbeji ngawo magə 28 kozəna yen.

sourceString: The World Health Organization and  Centers for Disease Control and Prevention of the United States advises pregnant women to do the same things as the general public to avoid infection, such as covering cough, avoid interacting with sick people, cleaning hands with soap and water or sanitizer.
targetString: World Health Organization-a Centers for Disease Control and Prevention lardə United States be dəye kamuwa surowa'a galazəna awowa jama meuye sadin də sandiye sadə kwasa də gotə ro katə nanka ro, misal ro kasau zaktə so, am dondi-a mu'amala dio ro katə so, mukko shawul-a nji-a lan tultə au awo mukko cintabe lan cintə so.

sourceString: A survey conducted in Shanghai among pregnant women in different trimesters of pregnancy identified a strong demand for online access to health information and services.
targetString: Sofiyo laa Shanghai lan dawu kamuwa surowa suro kəntagəwa gade gadeyen tədəna dəye məradə dunowa bayanna nəlewabe-a cidawa-a kəla intanetyen fando ye foduzəna.

sourceString: People expecting their first baby were more willing to have online consultation and guidance than who had previously given birth.The RCOG and RCM recommend that in-person appointments be deferred by 7 days after the start of symptoms of COVID-19 or 14 days if another person in the household has symptoms.
targetString: Am tadanza buro salakye təmazana də sandima zauro kasatsa kaala-a kashimo-a kəla intanet samoyin wo am buron sasambəna yaye ro. RCOG-a RCM-a ye shawari sadəna "appointment" au wadə kurube də kamye ngəmzəla ro sədəna də gərtəgə kau 7 ngawo alamawa COVID-19be badizənayen ro au kau 14 ro sa kam laa suro fatoyen alamawa fəlejiya.

sourceString: Fever subsequently developed in three asymptomatic patients.
targetString: Am tiyinzan alamawa ba yakkəye kange fantə badiyada.

sourceString: One patient who had tested negative subsequently became symptomatic postpartum and tested positive three days after the initial negative test.
targetString: Kam fal ngalnzəye tiyinzən ba fəlezəna də isə alamawa fəletə badiyono kuru ngawo kau yakkə ngal burobe ye dən sha ngallada nya tiyinzən mbeji ro wallono.

sourceString: The doctors conducting the screening recommended that in order to reduce infection and allocate PPE, due to high numbers of patients presenting as asymptomatic, universal screening of pregnant patients should be conducted.
targetString: Liyitawa do səkirinin sadin dəye shawari sadəna kwasa dəye amma kənta fulutu-a kuru PPE ammo yio-a, adadu am alamawa fəlezayimba ye nəm ngəwunzaye səkkə, səkrinin am dondi surowa dunya samma son tədəna ma ngəlawo.

sourceString: They also suggest that people with suspected or confirmed COVID-19 should have continuous electronic fetal monitoring.
targetString: Sandiye kuru shawari sadəna am COVID-19 sandiro təmatəgəna au tawattəgəna so də ninita tada surobe awo lantərkibe yen tədin də sambi so ro sadə sana.

sourceString: The use of birthing pools is not recommended for suspected or confirmed cases of COVID-19 due to the risk of infection via faeces.
targetString: Birthing pool au suro njiyen yembo dǝ waata lamarra COVID-19be tǝmatǝgǝna au tawattǝgǝna ro dalil nzǝ dǝ fujiwo bǝli men kwasa gotabe mbeji.

sourceString: In the UK, official recommendations state that precautionary separation of a mother and a healthy baby should not be undertaken lightly and that they should be kept together in the postpartum period where neonatal care is not required.Literature from China recommended separation of infected mothers from babies for 14 days.
targetString: UK lan, amariwa ofisbe ye wono, ya-a tadanzǝ kǝlwa-a yektǝ dǝ wande suli ro gotǝnyi, kuru na fal lan sandiya rotǝ sa adǝma kǝnzambi tuwandǝna dǝn, loktu doni cistǝgǝ ngawo kǝnzambi ye mǝradǝtǝnyi dǝn. Kǝra Chinabe laa ye amari ya'a dondi so-a ndulinza so-a kau 14 ro yektǝbe cina.

sourceString: In the US there is also the recommendation that newborns and mothers should be temporarily separated until transmission-based precautions are discontinued, and that where this is not possible the newborn should be kept 2 metres away from the mother.
targetString: US la yen amari au shawari nduli kǝli tambo bǝlinna so-a yanza so-a loktu gana laa ro yektǝbe mbeji hatta katapwa wande kam ro faltǝgǝnyi ro gotǝna dǝ rotiya do, kuru na adǝgai dǝ mowonjimba lan tada tambo bǝlinna dǝ mita indi kate sha yanzǝ'a yen mbeji do gǝnatǝ.

sourceString: b'COVID-19 surveillance involves monitoring the spread of the coronavirus disease in order to establish the patterns of disease progression.
targetString: b'COVID-19 ro shim ikkoye suron mbeji tartǝgǝ koronabairos be dǝ ninitǝgǝ sau duluwu kwasa dǝ fuwujinye dǝ notǝ ro.

sourceString: The World Health Organization (WHO) recommends active surveillance, with focus of case finding, testing and contact tracing in all transmission scenarios.
targetString: Karapka Nǝlewabe Dunyabe (WHO)ye shawari au amari shim ikko zazzauwwa ye cina, hangal lamarra au kessa fando-a, ngal dio-a kuru am kam dondiye letǝgǝna manǝm fando-a na faltǝgǝ wakajin wo son.

sourceString: COVID-19 surveillance is expected to monitor epidemiological trends, rapidly detect new cases, and based on this information, provide epidemiological information to conduct risk assessment and guide disease preparedness.
targetString: COVID-19 ro shim ikko dǝ wawa be fuwutǝ ninizǝyin, lamarra au kessa bǝlin duwa ro fodujin, kuru bayan shima dǝ futa men, bayan kǝla wawaben ci fujiwowa kulastǝ kuru kwasa ro dawartǝ shimojin ro tǝmatǝna.

sourceString: Syndromic surveillance is done based on the symptoms of an individual that corresponds to COVID-19.
targetString: Shim ikko halla kwasabe ro wutǝgǝ men tǝdin dǝ alamawa kam laa fal ye fǝlezǝna COVID-19'a kalkalzǝna ro wutǝgǝ men tǝdin.

sourceString: As of March 2020, the WHO recommends the following case definitions:
targetString: Kǝntagǝ Marchbe saa 2020be lan, WHOye ma'anawa lamarrabe anyi shawari au amari cina:

sourceString: Probable case : "A suspect case for whom testing for the COVID-19 virus is inconclusive" OR "a suspect case for whom testing could not be performed for any reason".
targetString: Lamar tǝmatǝna: "Lamar tǝnatǝgǝna ma doni ngal kuli kwasa COVID-19be tǝdǝna dǝ tamotǝnyi" AU "lamar tǝmatǝgǝna do dalil laaye sǝkkǝ ngal mowonzǝ tǝdin ba ma".

sourceString: Confirmed case: "A person with laboratory confirmation of COVID-19 infection, irrespective of clinical signs and symptoms".
targetString: Lamar tawattǝgǝna ma: "Kam do njim ngalbe lan tiyinzǝn kwasa COVID-19be mbeji ro tawattǝgǝna ma, alamawa kwasabe au nǝm dondibe mbeji au ba yaye".

sourceString: Direct physical contact with a probable or confirmed case;
targetString: Daata ro lamar tǝmatǝgǝna au tawattǝgǝna-a leta;

sourceString: Direct care for a patient with probable or confirmed COVID-19 disease without using proper personal protective equipment;
targetString: Daata ro kam dondi kwasa COVID-19be tǝmatǝgǝna au tawattǝgǝna ro cistaa karewa cidabe kǝla yitkawobe ngǝla faidatǝ ba lan;

sourceString: Other situations as indicated by local risk assessments".WHO recommends reporting of probable and confirmed cases of COVID-19 infection within 48 hours of identification.
targetString: Kǝndawa gade so futu kulashi fujiwobe fato'be ye fǝlezǝna ro". WHOye shawari lamar kwasa COVID-19be tǝmatǝna-a tawattǝgǝna-a suro awa 48ben sa fodutiya ngadartǝye cina.

sourceString: The countries should report on a case-by-case basis as far as possible, but in case of limitation in resources, aggregate weekly reporting is also possible.
targetString: Lardǝwa dǝ lamar-lamar (case-by-case) ro bayan sadǝ futu mowonjin ro, amma sa mbautǝ karewa cidabe wakajiya, bayan magǝbe samnǝm dio ye mowonjin.

sourceString: Some organizations have created crowdsourced apps for syndromic surveillance, where people can report their symptoms to help researchers map areas with concentration of COVID-19 symptoms.
targetString: Karapkawa laaye nazǝmuwa am alamawa kwasabe-a ro shim ikkobe satandǝna, na do am soye raksa alamawanzaye bayan sadǝ daji kulashiwu'a banaza na alamawa COVID-19be ngǝwu'a nozayin au kurzayin.

sourceString: Virological surveillance is done by using molecular tests for COVID-19.
targetString: Shim ikko kuli kwasabe'a leyata dǝ ngal shiro "molecular test" sayin dǝ dio men tǝdin.

sourceString: WHO has published resources for laboratories on how to perform testing for COVID-19.
targetString: WHOye karewa kǝla futu ngal COVID-19be tǝdin yen na'a ngal diobe ro baksǝ cina.

sourceString: In the European Union, laboratory confirmed cases of COVID-19 are reported within 24 hours of identification.
targetString: European Union au Majalis Lardǝwa Europebe lan, lamarra COVID-19be njim ngalbe lan tawattǝgǝna dǝ suro awa 24 bayantin ngawo asutǝna yen.

sourceString: At least 24 countries have established digital surveillance of their citizens.
targetString: Gananzǝ yaye lardǝwa 24 am nzǝ ro shim ikko nzundu zamanbe shiro "digital surveiance" sayin dǝ dio koksǝna.

sourceString: The digital surveillance technologies include apps, location data and electronic tags.
targetString: Nzunduwa zamanbe shim ikkobe dijitalbe ye suron nazǝmuwa au apps'a so, sapsawi bayanbe na dǝgammabe-a kuru awo shi ro "electronic tag" sayin dǝ'a samma mbeji.

sourceString: The Center For Disease Control and Prevention in USA tracks the travel information of individuals using airline passenger data.
targetString: Cidaram kwasa notobe-a kaltǝgǝbe-a USAbe dǝye bayan bǝlagurobe amma na kamfani lenǝm are maara samibe men zǝgayin.

sourceString: In Hong Kong, authorities are requiring a bracelet and an app for all travellers.
targetString: Hong Kong lan, huwuma'aye bǝlagurowu samma so ro awo mukko ro jero be-a "app"-a mazayin.

sourceString: A GPS app is used to track the locations of individuals in South Korea to ensure against quarantine breach, sending alerts to the user and to authorities if people leave designated areas.
targetString: South Korea lan manhaj GPS be faidatana na am so dasaana zasa'ain wande na sandiya ruwunza ro kortǝna kolzanyi ro tawattǝgǝ nankaro, kam faidatǝma-a huwuma-a ye hangal gerjin sa na gultǝna dǝ koltiya.

sourceString: In Singapore, individuals have to report their locations with photographic proof.
targetString: Singapore lan, am soye na dasaana shada fotobe'a ro bayanzayin.

sourceString: Thailand is using an app and SIM cards for all travelers to enforce their quarantine.
targetString: Thailand ye manhaj au app-a SIM kat-a faidatǝna bǝlagurowu samma so ro sandiya ruwunza ro kortǝ duno'atǝgǝ ro.

sourceString: Human rights organizations have criticized some of these measures, asking the governments not to use the pandemic as a cover to introduce invasive digital surveillance.
targetString: Karapkawa hakku adammanabe so laa ye katappa anyi ye laanza dǝ bassana, gomnatwa ro longorotaana wande wawa dǝ faidata am ro shim ikko dijital ye sakkǝnyi ro.

sourceString: b'Coronaviruses are a group of related viruses that cause diseases in mammals and birds.
targetString: b'Coronaviruses" so dǝ kuliwa kwasabe samun do tiyi dabbawa tada sasambǝ nganji sadin-a ngudowa so-a yen nǝm dondi au kwasa saudin dǝ.

sourceString: In humans, coronaviruses cause respiratory tract infections that can range from mild to lethal.
targetString: Adammana so lan, koronabairos dǝ kwasa diwal yintǝbe suwudin shi doni gana ngalau ma au zauro zauma.

sourceString: Mild illnesses include some cases of the common cold (which has other possible causes, predominantly rhinoviruses), while more lethal varieties can cause SARS, MERS, and COVID-19.
targetString: Nǝm dondi gana ngalauye suron lamarra tantanyi noataye mbeji (shi doni awowa gade so yaye sha suwudin ma, ngǝwu so ro "rhinoviruses"), adǝgaima jili wa zau gade so dǝ SARS, MERS, kuru COVID-19 so suwudin.

sourceString: Symptoms in other species vary: in chickens, they cause an upper respiratory tract disease, while in cows and pigs they cause diarrhea.
targetString: Alamawa kwasa dǝye dabbawa gade lan fafaltin: kuyi sol lan, kwasa diwal yintǝbe samiye saudin, adǝgaima fe so godu so lan shi dada saudin.

sourceString: There are yet to be vaccines or antiviral drugs to prevent or treat human coronavirus infections.
targetString: Kuwa yaye kalimi so au kurunna kuli kwasabe kwasa koronabairos adammanabe dǝ ba wo.

sourceString: Coronaviruses constitute the subfamily Orthocoronavirinae, in the family Coronaviridae, order Nidovirales, and realm Riboviria.
targetString: Koronabairos dǝ suro yalla gana "Orthocoronavirinae" lan kara, shi doni suro yalla "Coronaviridae" lan dǝgana ma, letǝram "Nidovirales"be, kǝrtǝ "Riboviria''be.

sourceString: They are enveloped viruses with a positive-sense single-stranded RNA genome and a nucleocapsid of helical symmetry.
targetString: Sandi dǝ kuliwa kwasabe do awo laa ambulop yedei sandiya zaksǝn kuru "positive-sense single stranded RNA genome" nzza-a "nucleocapsid"nza-a siffanzǝ gana korrata yedei-a.

sourceString: The genome size of coronaviruses ranges from approximately 26 to 32 kilobases, one of the largest among RNA viruses.
targetString: Nǝm kura "genome" koronabairosbe dǝ kilobez 28 yen sǝta 32 saadǝna, suro kuliwa kwasabe RNA lan shiye kura fal.

sourceString: They have characteristic club-shaped spikes that project from their surface, which in electron micrographs create an image reminiscent of the solar corona from which their name derives.
targetString: Tiyinzan awo laa jangallata suluwuna mbeji, shi doni suro "electron micrographbe lan" kamye surin maa foto "solar corona"-a samun, shi doni sunzǝ shi la tuwandǝna ma.

sourceString: Coronaviruses were first discovered in the 1930s when an acute respiratory infection of domesticated chickens was shown to be caused by infectious bronchitis virus (IBV).
targetString: Koronabairos so dǝ saa 1930 lan buro salak sandiya foduwatǝ sa kwasa yintǝbe kuyiya fatobe so dǝ kuli kwasabe shiro "infectious bronchitis virus" sayin de suwudin ro fǝletǝna dǝn.

sourceString: In the 1940s, two more animal coronaviruses, mouse hepatitis virus (MHV) and transmissible gastroenteritis virus (TGEV), were isolated.Human coronaviruses were discovered in the 1960s.
targetString: Karaa saa 1940 be lan, koronabairoswa indi gade, "mouse hepatitis virus (MHV)-a kuru transmissible gastroenteritis virus (TGEV)-a, tutuluuna. Koronabairos adammanabe dǝ karaa saa 1960 so ye dǝn foduwatǝ.

sourceString: The earliest ones studied were from human patients with the common cold, which were later named human coronavirus 229E and human coronavirus OC43.
targetString: Sandi do buro buro lan kǝratǝna dǝ tiyi am tantanyi-a yen tuwangatǝ, sandi ro dare su "human coronavirus 229E"-a kuru "human coronavirus OC43"-a cekko.

sourceString: They were first imaged by Scottish virologist June Almeida at St. Thomas Hospital in London.
targetString: Kuli kwasabe anyi buro salak yen fotonza dǝ ilmuma kǝla kuliwa kwasabe lardǝ Scotland be shiro June Almeida sayin dǝ litari St. Thomas London be dǝn citando.

sourceString: Other human coronaviruses have since been identified, including SARS-CoV in 2003, HCoV NL63 in 2004, HKU1 in 2005, MERS-CoV in 2012, and SARS-CoV-2 in 2019.
targetString: Coronavirus sa adammanabe gade kada tusuuna fodutǝna dǝ, suronzan SARS-CoV saa 2003 be-a, NL63 saa 2004be-a, HKU saa 2005be-a, MERS-CoV saa 2012be-a, SARS-CoV-2 saa 2019be-a samma mbeji.

sourceString: Most of these have involved serious respiratory tract infections.
targetString: Ngǝwunza so suronzan kwasa diwal yintǝbe zau ma mbeji.

sourceString: The name was first used in 1968 by an informal group of virologists in the journal Nature to designate the new family of viruses.
targetString: Su shima dǝ saa 1968 lan jami ilmuwu kuli kwasabe so laa fidatǝ suro mujall "Nature" be lan yalla kuliwa kwasabe dǝ asuta ro.

sourceString: The name refers to the characteristic appearance of virions (the infective form of the virus) by electron microscopy, which have a fringe of large, bulbous surface projections creating an image reminiscent of a crown or of a solar corona.
targetString: Su dǝ jili kuli kwasabe do "electron microscopy" lan turin do kam dondizǝyin dǝ nganzazǝ, shi doni tiyinzǝn awo laa zanzang suluwuna rumin maa alama kǝla maiye au "solar corona"-a samun.

sourceString: This morphology is created by the viral spike peplomers, which are proteins on the surface of the virus.
targetString: Siffanzǝ adǝ awo kuli kwasabe suluwuna dǝ sha sǝdǝ, sandi adǝye "protein" so sandi ro gulzayin tiyi kuli kwasabe dǝn.

sourceString: Coronaviruses are large pleomorphic spherical particles with bulbous surface projections.
targetString: Koronabairos so dǝ awowa kokorrata ma tiyinzan awo laa kura kura suluwuna ma.

sourceString: The envelope of the virus in electron micrographs appears as a distinct pair of electron dense shells.The viral envelope consists of a lipid bilayer where the membrane (M), envelope (E) and spike (S) structural proteins are anchored.
targetString: Ambulop au awo kuli kwasabe dǝga zaksǝna dǝ suro "electron micrograph"be lan farya "electron dense shell" yedei ro turin. Ambulop kuli kwasabe dǝ awo shiro "lipid bilayer" sayin dǝ mbeji na doni awo sha zaksǝna au "membrane (M)" dǝ-a, ambulop au "envelop (E)" dǝ-a, kuru "spike (S)"-a do proteinna tiyinzǝbe dǝ bakkata.

sourceString: The lipid bilayer envelope, membrane proteins, and nucleocapsid protect the virus when it is outside the host cell.
targetString: Ambulop "lipid bilayer"be dǝ-a, "protein"wa awo sha zaksǝnabe dǝ-a, kuru "nuclercapsid" dǝ-a dǝ kuli kwasabe dǝ'a saliwin sa shi tiyi kamma ai dabba yen gǝnyi maa.

sourceString: Coronaviruses contain a positive-sense, single-stranded RNA genome.
targetString: Coronaviruses so dǝ tiyinzan awo shiro "positive-sense, single-stranded RNA genome" sayin dǝ mbeji.

sourceString: The genome size for coronaviruses ranges from 26.4 to 31.7 kilobases.
targetString: Nǝm kura "genome" Coronaviruses be dǝ 26.4 kilobez lan sǝta 31.7 kilobez ro caado.

sourceString: The genome size is one of the largest among RNA viruses.
targetString: Nǝm kura "genome"nzabe adǝ suro kuliwa kwasabe RNAbe kura kurabe falnza.

sourceString: The open reading frames 1a and 1b, which occupy the first two-thirds of the genome, encode the replicase/transcriptase polyprotein.
targetString: Fǝremwa kǝratǝ kaatabe 1a kuru 1b-a, sandi doni ci indi burobe dǝn kasharu dǝ ''replicase/transcriptase polyprotein'' dǝ fasarjin.

sourceString: The replicase/transcriptase polyprotein self cleaves to form nonstructural proteins.The later reading frames encode the four major structural proteins: spike, envelope, membrane, and nucleocapsid.
targetString: Replicase/transcriptase polyprotein dǝ kǝlanzǝ yeksǝ "nonstructural protein" ro waljin. Fǝremwa kǝrabe dareye dǝye "structural proteins" kura kura ma sandi 4: "spike, envelop, membrane, kuru nucleocapsid-a"dǝ fasarjin.

sourceString: Interspersed between these reading frames are the reading frames for the accessory proteins.
targetString: Ndi kate fǝremwa kǝrabe indi anyibe ro fǝremwa kǝrabe "accessory proteins"be tuskaata.

sourceString: The number of accessory proteins and their function is unique depending on the specific coronavirus.
targetString: Adadu "accessory proteins"be-a faidanza-a dǝ jili koronabairosbe dǝn kara.

sourceString: Infection begins when the viral spike (S) glycoprotein attaches to its complementary host cell receptor.
targetString: Kwasa au nǝm dondi kamma kǝnta badijin sa "viral spike (S) glycoprotein" tiyi "host cell receptor" au sel tiyi sototǝmanzǝye ro kǝrtǝgǝiyya.

sourceString: After attachment, a protease of the host cell cleaves and activates the receptor-attached spike protein.
targetString: Ngawo kǝrtǝgǝna yen, "protease" sel sototǝma dǝye "receptor attached spiked protein"dǝ'a yekcinye kuru cidajin ro sǝdinye.

sourceString: Depending on the host cell protease available, cleavage and activation allows the virus to enter the host cell by endocytosis or direct fusion of the viral envelop with the host membrane.On entry into the host cell, the virus particle is uncoated, and its genome enters the cell cytoplasm.
targetString: Protease sel sototǝma ye mbeji ma dǝ ro wuntǝgǝ men, yektǝ-a cidajin ro dio-a dǝ kuli kwasabe dǝ'a kolzǝ tiyi sel sototǝmabe ro "endocytosis" men gayin au daata ro ambulop kuli kwasabe dǝ-a "membrane" sototǝmabe-a kǝltǝ men gayin. Sa tiyi sel sototǝmabe ro gana lan, kuli kwasabe dǝ lintǝ daji "genome"nzǝ sel dǝro gayin.

sourceString: The host ribosome translates the initial overlapping open reading frame of the virus genome and forms a long polyprotein.
targetString: Host ribosome dǝye fǝrem kaata ro kǝratin "genome" kuli kwasabe dǝye fasarjin kuru "polyprotein" kuruwu sǝtandin.

sourceString: The polyprotein has its own proteases which cleave the polyprotein into multiple nonstructural proteins.
targetString: Polyprotein dǝ "proteases" ngǝmzǝbe mbeji sha "nonstructural proteins" kada ro yekcin ma.

sourceString: A number of the nonstructural proteins coalesce to form a multi-protein replicase-transcriptase complex (RTC).
targetString: Nonstructural proteins kada kǝlta awo do shiro "multi-protein replicase-transcriptase complex (RTC)" sayin dǝ satandin.

sourceString: The main replicase-transcriptase protein is the RNA-dependent RNA polymerase (RdRp).
targetString: Replicase-transcriptase protein nasku m dǝ shima shiro "RNA-dependent RNA polymerase (RdRp) sayin dǝ.

sourceString: It is directly involved in the replication and transcription of RNA from an RNA strand.
targetString: Shi dǝ daata ro suro ngǝwutǝ-a tando-a RNAbe je RNA fal ye lan mbeji.

sourceString: The other nonstructural proteins in the complex assist in the replication and transcription process.
targetString: Nonstructural proteins gabsana dǝ duluwu ngǝwutǝgǝ-a tandobe-a dǝn banazayin.

sourceString: The exoribonuclease nonstructural protein, for instance, provides extra fidelity to replication by providing a proofreading function which the RNA-dependent RNA polymerase lacks.One of the main functions of the complex is to replicate the viral genome.
targetString: Awo shiro "exoribonuclease nonstructural protein" sayin dǝ, misal ro, ngǝwutǝgǝ ro mbǝrshe gade sǝrayin faida taltǝ kulastabe do na "RNA- dependent RNA polymerase"yen ba yio men. Cida awo dǝye dunoa fal dǝ shima "viral genome" dǝ'a ngǝwutǝgǝ.

sourceString: RdRp directly mediates the synthesis of negative-sense genomic RNA from the positive-sense genomic RNA.
targetString: Awo shiro "RdRp" sayin dǝ daata ro lezǝna ishin suro lamar "negative-sense genomic RNA" tiyi "positive-sense genomic RNA"be lan tandobe dǝn.

sourceString: This is followed by the replication of positive-sense genomic RNA from the negative-sense genomic RNA.
targetString: Ngawo adǝye ngǝwutǝgǝ "positive-sense genomic RNA tiyi "negative-sense genomic RNA"be zǝgayin.

sourceString: The other important function of the complex is to transcribe the viral genome.
targetString: Faida awo adǝye kura fal dǝ shima "viral genome dǝ'a faltǝgǝ.

sourceString: RdRp directly mediates the synthesis of negative-sense subgenomic RNA molecules from the positive-sense genomic RNA.
targetString: Awo shiro "RdRp" sayin dǝ daata ro lezǝna ishin suro lamar "negative-sense subgenomic RNA molecules" tiyi "positive-sense genomic RNA"be lan tandobe dǝn.

sourceString: This is followed by the transcription of these negative-sense subgenomic RNA molecules to their corresponding positive-sense mRNAs.
targetString: Ngawo adǝye "negative-sense subgenomic RNA molecules" anyi "positive-sense mRNA" ro faltǝgǝ zǝgayin.

sourceString: The replicated positive-sense genomic RNA becomes the genome of the progeny viruses.
targetString: Positive-sense genomic RNA ngǝwutǝgǝna ma dǝ "genome" kuliwa kwasabe bǝlin ro tuwandǝna dǝbe ro waljin.

sourceString: The mRNAs are gene transcripts of the last third of the virus genome after the initial overlapping reading frame.
targetString: mRNAs so dǝ sandima "gene transcripts" ci kǝn yakkǝme darebe "genome" kuli kwasabe dǝ ngawo fǝrem kǝrabe burobe dǝ kǝla kamanzǝbe ro zuwa kojiya.

sourceString: These mRNAs are translated by the host's ribosomes into the structural proteins and a number of accessory proteins.
targetString: mRNAwa anyi "ribosomes" sototǝmabe sandiya "structural proteins"-a kuru "accessory proteins" kada-a ro fasarzǝyin.

sourceString: RNA translation occurs inside the endoplasmic reticulum.
targetString: Fasari RNAbe dǝ suro "endoplsmic reticulum" be lan wakajin.

sourceString: The viral structural proteins S, E, and M move along the secretory pathway into the Golgi intermediate compartment.
targetString: Viral structural proteins S, E, kuru M dǝ zawal shiro "secretory pathway" me dǝn na shiro "Golgi intermediate compartment" sayin dǝ ro lezayin.

sourceString: There, the M proteins direct most protein-protein interactions required for assembly of viruses following its binding to the nucleocapsid.
targetString: Na dǝn, "M proteins"ye mu'amalawa ndikate purotin-a purotin-ayer kuliwa kwasabe na fal ro saptǝgǝye ngawo "nucleocapsid"nzǝ ro foktǝgǝnaye ngǝwu so sunotin.

sourceString: Progeny viruses are then released from the host cell by exocytosis through secretory vesicles.
targetString: Kuliwa kwasabe bǝlin ro tuwandǝna sodǝ tiyi sel sototǝma yen "exocytosis" men zutǝ tutuluyin "secretory vessicles" men.

sourceString: The interaction of the coronavirus spike protein with its complement host cell receptor is central in determining the tissue tropism, infectivity, and species range of the virus.
targetString: Muamala "spike protein" koronabairosbe-a "complement host cell receptor"nzǝ-aye dǝ zauro nasha awo shiro "tissue tropism"-a, raktǝ kwasa sangobe-a, kuru jili kuli kwasabe dǝ-a notǝ yen zauro faidajin.

sourceString: The SARS coronavirus, for example, infects human cells by attaching to the angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2) receptor.
targetString: Coronaviruses SARSdǝ, misal ro, sel adammana so dondizǝyin awo shiro "angiotensin-converting enzyme 2 (ACE2) receptor" sayin dǝ ro kǝrtǝgǝ men.

sourceString: The scientific name for coronavirus is Orthocoronavirinae or Coronavirinae.
targetString: Su Coronaviruses be ilmu "science"be dǝ shima "Orthocoronavirinae" au Coronavirinae.

sourceString: Coronaviruses belong to the family of Coronaviridae, order Nidovirales, and realm Riboviria.
targetString: Coronaviruses so dǝ suro yalla "Coronaviridae" lan kasharu, tartib "Nidovirales"be, kuru letǝgǝram "Riboviria"be lan.

sourceString: Genus Betacoronavirus; type species: Murine coronavirus
targetString: Genus Betacoronavirus; type species: Murine coronavirus

sourceString: Species: Betacoronavirus 1 (Bovine Coronavirus, Human coronavirus OC43), Human coronavirus HKU1, Murine coronavirus, Pipistrellus bat coronavirus HKU5, Rousettus bat coronavirus HKU9, Severe acute respiratory syndrome-related coronavirus (SARS-CoV, SARS-CoV-2), Tylonycteris bat coronavirus HKU4, Middle East respiratory syndrome-related coronavirus, Hedgehog coronavirus 1 (EriCoV)
targetString: Species: Betacoronavirus 1 (Bovine Coronavirus, Human coronavirus OC43), Human coronavirus HKU1, Murine coronavirus, Pipistrellus bat coronavirus HKU5, Rousettus bat coronavirus HKU9, Severe acute respiratory syndrome-related coronavirus (SARS-CoV, SARS-CoV-2), Tylonycteris bat coronavirus HKU4, Middle East respiratory syndrome-related coronavirus, Hedgehog coronavirus 1 (EriCoV)

sourceString: Species: Beluga whale coronavirus SW1, Infectious bronchitis virus
targetString: Species: Beluga whale coronavirus SW1, Infectious bronchitis virus

sourceString: The most recent common ancestor (MRCA) of all coronaviruses is estimated to have existed as recently as 8000 BCE, although some models place the common ancestor as far back as 55 million years or more, implying long term coevolution with bat and avian species.
targetString: Yayya Coronaviruses wa sammasobe zauro karungube dǝ saa 8000 BCE kozǝna dǝ yedei man mbeji ro tǝmatǝna, awowa tuwandǝna au "models" laa soye yayyanza dǝ saa miliyon 55 yedei ma mbeji sana, adǝye fǝlezǝna loktu kuruwu ro batata so ngudowa gade so-a dasaana.

sourceString: The most recent common ancestor of the alphacoronavirus line has been placed at about 2400 BCE, the betacoronavirus line at 3300 BCE, the gammacoronavirus line at 2800 BCE, and the deltacoronavirus line at about 3000 BCE.
targetString: Yayya zauro karungube "alphacoronavirus" be dǝ saa 2400 BCE lan gǝnaatǝ, "betacoronavirus" so dǝ saa 3300 BCE lan gǝnaatǝ, "gammacoronavirus" so dǝ saa 2800 BCE lan gǝnaatǝ, kuru "deltacoronavirus" so dǝ saa 3000 BCE yedei lan gǝnaatǝ.

sourceString: The large number of host bat and avian species, and their global range, has enabled extensive evolution and dissemination of coronaviruses.Many human coronavirus have their origin in bats.
targetString: Adadu batata so ngudowa so kuli kwasabe sotozayin dǝ-a nǝm ngǝwunza dunya samma sobe-a ye sǝkkǝ fafaltǝ koronabairosbe-a tatartǝgǝnza-a yita mowonzǝna. Koronabairos adammanabe ngǝwuso furtunza batata.

sourceString: More recently, alpaca coronavirus and human coronavirus 229E diverged sometime before 1960.
targetString: Zauro karungu lan, Coronaviruses ''alpaca"be-a koronabairos 229E adammanabe-a dǝ kau saa 1960 wo ro yekkata.

sourceString: MERS-CoV emerged in humans from bats through the intermediate host of camels.
targetString: MERS-CoV dǝ batata so men adammana son fǝlangono sototǝma ndikate dǝye kalimowa men.

sourceString: MERS-CoV, although related to several bat coronavirus species, appears to have diverged from these several centuries ago.
targetString: Kuli kwasabe MERS-CoV, Coronaviruses kada'a leyata yaye, alamanzǝ dǝ sandi adǝ man yekkatǝ saa yer kada kozǝna dǝn.

sourceString: The most closely related bat coronavirus and SARS-CoV diverged in 1986.
targetString: Coronaviruses batatabe zauro karungu ro letna-a SARS-CoV-a dǝ saa 1986be lan yekkata.

sourceString: A possible path of evolution, of SARS coronavirus and keen bat coronaviruses, suggests that SARS related coronaviruses coevolved in bats for a long time.
targetString: Diwal fafaltǝbe mowonjin ma, koronabairos SARSbe-a koronabairos batatabe-a ye fǝlezǝna Coronaviruses SARS'a leyata so dǝ tiyi batata soyen loktu kuruwu ro rokko dasaana.

sourceString: In the 1790s, equine coronavirus diverged from the bovine coronavirus after a cross-species jump.
targetString: Kate saa 1790s be lan, Coronaviruses fǝr-a dabbawa gade sha samun jili koro so-aye dǝ koronabairos fe-a dabbawa gade sha samun-a ye dǝ lan yekkata ngawo jili fl yen cizǝ jili gade ro kozǝna yen.

sourceString: Later in the 1890s, human coronavirus OC43 diverged from bovine coronavirus after another cross-species spillover event.
targetString: Dare kate saa 1890s be lan, Coronaviruses adammanabe OC43dǝ koronabairos fe soyen yekkatǝ ngawo waltǝ jili dabbaye fal lan cizǝ gade ro kozǝna yen.

sourceString: It is speculated that the flu pandemic of 1890 may have been caused by this spillover event, and not by the influenza virus, because of the related timing, neurological symptoms, and unknown causative agent of the pandemic.
targetString: Wawa kwasa fulu au tantanyibe saa 1890be dǝ awo buron wakazǝna dǝ sha suwudǝ ro gotǝna, kuru kuli kwasabe infuluyenzabe dǝ gǝnyi ro, dalil nǝm karungu loktu dǝye-a, alamawa kwasabe-a, kuru awo wawa dǝ'a suwudǝna notǝnyi ma-a.

sourceString: Human coronavirus OC43 besides causing respiratory infections is also suspected of playing a role in neurological diseases.
targetString: Coronaviruses adammanabe OC43 ngawo kwasa yintǝbe suwudinyen kwasa gade soye suwudin ro tǝmatǝna.

sourceString: In the 1950s, the human coronavirus OC43 began to diverge into its present genotypes.
targetString: Kate saa 1950be lan, Coronaviruses OC43 adammanabe dǝ jiliwanzǝ kǝmaaye dǝ ro yektǝ badiyono.

sourceString: Phylogentically, mouse hepatitis virus (Murine coronavirus), which infects the mouse's liver and the central nervous system, is related to  human coronavirus OC43 and bovine coronavirus.
targetString: Nasha fafaltǝye men, kuli kwasa "hepatitis"be (Murine coronavirus) do kǝmattǝn julwabe-a nzundu fantǝ tiyibe-a lejin dǝ, koronabairos OC43 adammanabe-a koronabairos fe soye-a leyata.

sourceString: Human coronavirus HKU1, like the aforementioned viruses, also has its origins in rodents.
targetString: Koronabairos HKU1 adammanabe, kuliwa kwasabe buron sunza tǝtana yedei, shiye jili dabbawa julwa so yedei lan ciyono.

sourceString: Coronaviruses vary significantly in risk factor.
targetString: Coronaviruses so dǝ jili fujiwonza soye dǝ gade gadezǝna.

sourceString: Some can kill more than 30% of those infected, such as MERS-CoV, and some are relatively harmless, such as the common cold.
targetString: Laanza dǝ awo sǝtanaye suron ci 30% ma kozǝna cenin, misal ro MERS-CoV, kuru laanza illanza gana, misal ro tantanyi noata ma

sourceString: Coronaviruses can cause colds with major symptoms, such as fever, and a sore throat from swollen adenoids.
targetString: Koronabairos so dǝ amusu alamawa nǝm dondibe gade gade'a suwudin, misal ro kange-a dau lilimta au warjin sau "adenoids" fuzǝna yen.

sourceString: Coronaviruses can cause pneumonia (either direct viral pneumonia or secondary bacterial pneumonia) and bronchitis (either direct viral bronchitis or secondary bacterial bronchitis).
targetString: Koronabairos so dǝ nimoniya saudin (nimoniya kuli kwasabe au nimoniya bakteriyabe kura ma) kuru buronkayetis ye saudin (buronkayetis kuli kwasabe au buronkayetis bakteriyabe kura ma).

sourceString: The human coronavirus discovered in 2003, SARS-CoV, which causes severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS), has a unique pathogenesis because it causes both upper and lower respiratory tract infections.Six species of human coronaviruses are known, with one species subdivided into two different strains, making seven strains of human coronaviruses altogether.
targetString: Koronabairos adammanabe saa 2003 lan fodutǝna ma, SARS-CoV, shi doni kwasa yintǝbe shiro "severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS) sayin dǝ suwudin dǝ, duluwu kamma donditǝgǝnzǝbe dǝ gade'a gade dalilnzǝ dǝ kwasa diwal yintǝbe samibe-a cidiyabe-a ndi so suwudin. koronabairoswa adammanabe jili arakkǝ noata, jili fal dǝ indi ro yekkatǝ, samma so jiliwa tulur ro wallada.

sourceString: Four of these coronaviruses continually circulate in the human population and produce the generally mild symptoms of the common cold in adults and children worldwide: -OC43, -HKU1, HCoV-229E, -NL63.
targetString: Sandi diyeu dǝ sambi so ro jumla amma lan dǝrizana kǝlzayin kuru alamawa zau gǝnyi tantanyibe dǝ saudin ammurawa-a nduliya lan dunya samma son: -OC43, -HKU1, HCoV-229E, -NL63.

sourceString: Coronaviruses cause about 15% of commons colds.
targetString: Koronabairos so dǝ ci 15% karunga tantanyi noatabe saudin.

sourceString: The majority of colds are caused by rhinoviruses.
targetString: Tantanyiwa ngǝwuso "rhinoviruses" sandiya saudin.

sourceString: The four mild coronaviruses have a seasonal incidence occurring in the winter months in temperate climates.
targetString: Koronbairoswa zau gǝnyi sandi diyeu dǝ zaman ln bayantayin suro kǝntagǝwa binǝm be lan.

sourceString: There is no preference towards a particular season in tropical climates.
targetString: Zaman laa tǝraana so ba na'a gana kaudo'a lan.

sourceString: Four human coronaviruses produce symptoms that are generally mild:
targetString: Koronabairoswa adammanabe sandi diyeu alamawa gana ngalau ro kamma sakkin:

sourceString: The virus was officially named the SARS coronavirus (SARS-CoV).
targetString: Kuli kwasabe dǝ sha "SARS coronavirus (SARS-CoV)" lan bowotin.

sourceString: More than 8,000 people were infected, about ten percent of whom died.
targetString: Am 8000 ma kozǝna sǝtana, suro dǝn ci 10% yedei bazana.

sourceString: In September 2012, a new type of coronavirus was identified, initially called Novel Coronavirus 2012, and now officially named Middle East respiratory syndrome coronavirus (MERS-CoV).
targetString: Kǝntagǝ Septemberye saa 2012 lan, koronabairos jili bǝlin asutǝna, buro slakyen "Novel Coronavirus 2012'' lan bowotin, amma kǝrmaa dǝ "Middle East respiratory syndrome coronavirus (MERS-CoV) lan bowotin.

sourceString: The World Health Organization issued a global alert soon after.
targetString: Karapka Nǝlewabe Dunyabe dǝye bariya dunyala tini ngawo dǝn ceno.

sourceString: The WHO update on 28 September 2012 said the virus did not seem to pass easily from person to person.
targetString: Bayan WHObe kǝntagǝ Septemberye kaunzǝ 28 saa 2012be dǝye wono kuli kwasabe dǝ futu kvske lan kam kam ro faltǝyimba.

sourceString: However, on 12 May 2013, a case of human-to-human transmission in France was confirmed by the French Ministry of Social Affairs and Health.
targetString: Adǝgaima, kǝntagǝ Marchbe kaunzǝ 12 saa 2013be lan, lamar kam lan kam gade ro faltǝgǝbe lardǝ Francebe lan cidaram shiro "French Ministry of Social Affairs and Health" sayin dǝye tawatsǝgǝna.

sourceString: In addition, cases of human-to-human transmission were reported by the Ministry of Health in Tunisia.
targetString: Adǝ ro nzǝra lan, lamarra kam kam ro faltǝgǝye cidaram nǝlewabe Tunisiabe ye ngadarzǝna.

sourceString: Two confirmed cases involved people who seemed to have caught the disease from their late father, who became ill after a visit to Qatar and Saudi Arabia.
targetString: Lamarra tawattǝgǝna indi suro dǝn am laa baanza maitube na lan kwasa dǝ alama gozanaye mbeji, sandi do ngawo Qatar-a Saudi Arabia-a ro ziyara saadǝna yen dondizana dǝ.

sourceString: Despite this, it appears the virus had trouble spreading from human to human, as most individuals who are infected do not transmit the virus.
targetString: Adǝ son yaye, kuli kwasabe dǝ alama kam kam ro faltǝgǝ lan gana kazǝyi suwandǝna, dalilnzǝ dǝ am sandiya sǝtana ngǝwu so kuli kwasabe dǝ am gade ro falzayimba.

sourceString: The final name for the virus is Middle East respiratory syndrome coronavirus (MERS-CoV).
targetString: Su dare dajirambe kuli kwasabe dǝ ro tǝkkǝna dǝ shima "Middle East respiratory syndrome coronavirus (MERS-CoV).

sourceString: The only U.S. cases (both survived) were recorded in May 2014.In May 2015, an outbreak of MERS-CoV occurred in the Republic of Korea, when a man who had traveled to the Middle East, visited four hospitals in the Seoul area to treat his illness.
targetString: Lamarra U.S.be ndi jong (ndi so kǝnǝngatana) kǝntagǝ Maybe saa 2014be ln rekod ro gaana. Kǝntagǝ May saa 2015, fǝlangno MERS-CoVbe "Republic of Korea" lan wakawono,sa konga laa Gǝdi dauzǝna ro bǝlagurozǝna ye litariwa diyeu ro ziyara caado nasha Seoulbe lan kwasanzǝ ro kurun dio nanka ro.

sourceString: This caused one of the largest outbreaks of MERS-CoV outside the Middle East.
targetString: Advye fǝlangno MERS-CoV ye kura fal suwudǝna dia'a Gǝdi dauzǝna be lan.

sourceString: As of December 2019, 2,468 cases of MERS-CoV infection had been confirmed by laboratory tests, 851 of which were fatal, a mortality rate of approximately 34.5%.
targetString: Kǝntagǝ Decemberye saa 2019be lan, lamar kwasa MERS-CoVbe sndi 2,468 ngal njim ngal diobe men tawattǝgǝna, suro dǝn sandi 851 dǝ ba'ada, nǝm ngǝwu kǝrmuye ci 34.5%.

sourceString: In December 2019, a pneumonia outbreak was reported in Wuhan, China.
targetString: Kǝntagǝ december saa 2019be lan, fǝlangno nimoniyabe Wuhan, China lan bayantǝna.

sourceString: On 31 December 2019, the outbreak was traced to a novel strain of coronavirus, which was given the interim name 2019-nCoV by the World Health Organization (WHO), later renamed SARS-CoV-2 by the International Committee on Taxonomy of Viruses.
targetString: Kǝntagǝ Decemberye kaunzǝ 31 saa 2019, fǝlangno dǝ jili koronabairosbe bǝlin ro gǝna'atǝgǝ, shi doni su loktu gnabe 2019-nCoV karapka nǝlewabe dunyabe ye shiro sǝkkǝna dǝ, dare su dǝ SARS-CoV-2 ro "the International Committee on Taxonomy of Viruses" ye faljio.

sourceString: Some researchers have suggested the Huanan Seafood Wholesale Market may not be the original source of viral transmission to humans.As of 17 April 2020, there have been at least 153,822 confirmed deaths and more than 2,240,191 confirmed cases in the coronavirus pneumonia pandemic.
targetString: Kulashiwu laaye kasuwu "Huanan Seafood Wholesale Market" be dǝ shima na do kuli kwasabe dǝ cizǝna wo ro waljimba sa manazana. Kǝntagǝ Aprilbe saa 2020be lan, gananzǝ yaye kǝrmuwa tawattǝgǝna 153,822 yedei mbeji kuru lamarra tawattǝgǝna 2,240,191 yedei mbeji suro wawa nimoniya koronabairosbe dǝn.

sourceString: The Wuhan strain has been identified as a new strain of Betacoronavirus from group 2B with approximately 70% genetic similarity to the SARS-CoV.
targetString: Jili kuli kwsabe Wuhanbe dǝ jili "Betacoronavirus"be bǝlin ma jami 2b ye ro asutǝna, sha SARS-CoV-a nǝmsamun ci 70% yedei mbeji.

sourceString: The virus has a 96% similarity to a bat coronavirus, so it is widely suspected to originate from bats as well.
targetString: Kuli kasuwabedǝ alamaram sana 96% coronavirus batatabega mbeji adǝbe sǝkǝ tǝma gargam dǝbe dǝ batatalan tǝwndobega.

sourceString: The pandemic has resulted in travel restrictions and nationwide lockdowns in several countries.
targetString: Wawa adǝbe sǝkǝ lenǝm areso a Dunya sammalan kaltǝna kuru lardǝga kadan fasal nǝm kulebega gotǝna.

sourceString: Coronaviruses have been recognized as causing pathological conditions in veterinary medicine since the 1930s.
targetString: Fodǝtǝ coronavirus bedǝ shima hal pathological beg kurun lita dabbabedro tǝn sa'a 1930 sǝwudǝ.

sourceString: Except for avian infectious bronchitis, the major related diseases have mainly an intestinal location.
targetString: Illa kasuwa suwumbe avianbe shiro bronchitis gultindǝ dawun baro, kasuwa gade sandiya tiloamadǝ kasuwa kalǝmbewo.

sourceString: Coronaviruses primarily infect the upper respiratory and gastrointestinal tract of mammals and birds.
targetString: Coronaviruses badiyaram lan respiratory a gastrointestinal dabba au Adam gana shil ngawobega ngudowa sǝtain.

sourceString: They also cause a range of diseases in farm animals and domesticated pets, some of which can be serious and are a threat to the farming industry.
targetString: Kasuwalasobe dabba buribega fatogalan tǝwandindǝ taidazǝ sanyaram kulobesoro hanaglla sǝsangǝna.

sourceString: In chickens, the infectious bronchitis virus (IBV), a coronavirus, targets not only the respiratory tract but also the urogenital tract.
targetString: Kuyilan kuli kasuwabe bronchitis be IBV a coronavirusbe adǝ respiratory tilo gǝnyi hatta urogenitallin kunten.

sourceString: The virus can spread to different organs throughout the chicken.
targetString: Kulidǝ kunduwu a gade-gadero tartain diwal kuyibelan.

sourceString: Economically significant coronaviruses of farm animals include porcine coronavirus (transmissible gastroenteritis coronavirus, TGE) and bovine coronavirus, which both result in diarrhea in young animals.
targetString: Faida lamarra arziyibe dabba buribero coronaviruslan tǝwandǝnadǝbe suron porcine coronavirus sha (gastrenteritis faltǝ Coronavirusbe TGE) be ma kuru bovine coronovirsbe shila shidada dabba citǝbulinmiyega tǝwando.

sourceString: Feline coronavirus: two forms, feline enteric coronavirus is a pathogen of minor clinical significance, but spontaneous mutation of this virus can result in feline infectious peritonitis (FIP), a disease associated with high mortality.
targetString: Feline coronavirus: sandi indi, sandima feline enteric coronavirus a pathogen a faida gana litabega, amma kuli kasuwabedǝ shilan kasuwa feline infectious peritonitis (FIP) dǝga tǝwando, kasuwa adǝlan tajirwa na koji tǝwandin.

sourceString: Similarly, there are two types of coronavirus that infect ferrets: Ferret enteric coronavirus causes a gastrointestinal syndrome known as epizootic catarrhal enteritis (ECE), and a more lethal systemic version of the virus (like FIP in cats) known as ferret systemic coronavirus (FSC).
targetString: Kawulila adǝga samungo ayelan Coronavirusdǝ jili indi; Enteric Coronavirusdǝ shima alamaram Gastrointestinalbe epizootic ECE shilan tǝwandin kuruson kuli a gade sndiga FIP a FSC a samma mbeji.

sourceString: There are two types of canine coronavirus (CCoV), one that causes mild gastrointestinal disease and one that has been found to cause respiratory disease.
targetString: Canin coronavirus (CCoV), dǝ indi sandima faldǝ shima kasuwa gastrointestinal bega suwudin kuru faldǝbe kasuwa fufube sǝwudin.

sourceString: Mouse hepatitis virus (MHV) is a coronavirus that causes an epidemic murine illness with high mortality, especially among colonies of laboratory mice.
targetString: Kasuwa funobe sha (MHV) shiye coronavirus sǝwudin adǝyeyima kasuwa am taidazǝ lorujinna samma hatta colonies yin kunten.

sourceString: Sialodacryoadenitis virus (SDAV) is highly infectious coronavirus of laboratory rats, which can be transmitted between individuals by direct contact and indirectly by aerosol.
targetString: Kuli kasuwabe Sialodacryoadenitis (SDAV) shiye coronavirus jilawabe taidazǝ kamma zamjinma njim kulashibe laboratorilan fodǝtǝnamawo kuru shi donyi kam falla cizǝ kafal kojin diwal muamalabemen.

sourceString: Some strains of MHV cause a progressive demyelinating encephalitis in mice which has been used as a murine model for multiple sclerosis.
targetString: Alama raktǝ MHV fuwutǝ demyelinating encephalitis bega suwudin.

sourceString: Significant research efforts have been focused on elucidating the viral pathogenesis of these animal coronaviruses, especially by virologists interested in veterinary and zoonotic diseases.
targetString: Kulashi faidatǝdindǝn hangalla coronavirus dabbabe shiro elucidating a pathogenesis beg dǝro tǝna hasatanma kasuwa zoonotic bewo.

sourceString: Porcine coronavirus (transmissible gastroenteritis coronavirus of pigs, TGEV).
targetString: Kuli Porcine coronavirus be (gastroenteritis Godube TGEV) be so.

sourceString: Bovine coronavirus (BCV), responsible for severe profuse enteritis in of young calves.
targetString: Bovine coronavirus (BCV) hakku kasuwa citǝbulinmi zamjin dǝgaso.

sourceString: Feline coronavirus (FCoV) causes mild enteritis in cats as well as severe Feline infectious peritonitis (other variants of the same virus).
targetString: Feline coronavirus (FCoV) shima mild enteritis ngambewo as peritonitis na kojiro kam zamjin madǝwo (kuli virus gafsǝna).

sourceString: the two types of canine coronavirus (CCoV) (one causing enteritis, the other found in respiratory diseases).
targetString: Canine coronavirus (CCoV) dǝ sandi indi (faldǝ shima enteritis sǝwudin, kamanzǝdǝ kasuwa fufube respiratory diseases dǝ sǝwudin).

sourceString: Turkey coronavirus (TCV) causes enteritis in turkeys.
targetString: Coronavirus tolotolobedǝ (TCV) shima kasuwa enteritisbe tolotolobega sǝwudin.

sourceString: Ferret enteric coronavirus causes epizootic catarrhal enteritis in ferrets.
targetString: Coronavirus Ferret entericbedǝ shima epizootic catarrhal enteritis dǝga ferretsdǝro suwudin.

sourceString: Ferret systemic coronavirus causes FIP-like systemic syndrome in ferrets.
targetString: Coronavirus Ferretbedǝ shima FIP-lalamana alamaram kasuwa ferretsbe.

sourceString: Rabbit enteric coronavirus causes acute gastrointestinal disease and diarrhea in young European rabbits.
targetString: Kasuwa coronavirus Tarwunabedǝ shima kasuwa gastrointestinalbe a shidada tarwuna citǝ bulinmi lardǝ Europebedǝro sǝwudin.

sourceString: Porcine epidemic diarrhea virus (PED or PEDV), has emerged around the world.
targetString: Wawa kuli shidadabe Porcinebe sha (PED au PEDV) dunya samman fulengono.
